class.name: FigureOfSpeech
class.desc: A word or phrase used in a non-literal sense for rhetorical or vivid effect

objectProperty.name: isPresentIn
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the text (instance of Redaction) which contains the current item under analysis

objectProperty.name: isPresentIn
objectProperty.desc: This property points to one of the lines (instance of Line) which contains the current item under analysis

objectProperty.name: isPresentIn
objectProperty.desc: This property points to one of the words (instance of Word) which contains the current item under analysis

objectProperty.name: hasPart
objectProperty.desc: The current instance of FigureOfSpeech can be decompounded in smaller units for a more granular anlysis (e.g. a kenning made of other kennings)

objectProperty.name: isPart
objectProperty.desc: The current instance of FigureOfSpeech is a smaller unit of another instance of FigureOfSpeech

objectProperty.name: isRelatedWith
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the instance of Word which has the current FigureOfSpeech. This FigureOfSpeech is present in another instance of Word that has been previously related to the current FigureOfSpeech through the object property presents

objectProperty.name: isRelatedWith
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the instance of Line which has the current FigureOfSpeech. This FigureOfSpeech is present in another instance of Line that has been previously related to the current FigureOfSpeech through the object property presents

dataProperty.name: category
dataProperty.label: Category
dataProperty.desc: Categorisation of the item at hand. In the case of FigureOfSpeech, the main categories are usually “trope” and “scheme”

dataProperty.name: device
dataProperty.label: Name of literary device
dataProperty.desc: A literary contrivance, such as parallelism or personification, used to achieve a particular effect

dataProperty.name: content
dataProperty.label: Content
dataProperty.desc: Full content of item

dataProperty.name: commentary
dataProperty.label: Commentary
dataProperty.desc: An explanatory series of notes or comments; an explanatory essay or treatise on a text

dataProperty.name: periphrasis
dataProperty.label: Periphrasis (e.g. kenning)
dataProperty.desc: A circumlocution, a roundabout expression

dataProperty.name: periphrasisTranslation
dataProperty.label: Periphrasis translation
dataProperty.desc: A literal translation of a periphrasis

dataProperty.name: periphrasisReferent
dataProperty.label: Referent of periphrasis
dataProperty.desc: Unspoken name which is equivalent to the periphrasis

class.name: Intertextuality
class.desc: Shared textual materials between two or more contemporary texts; Text from which information or ideas are derived for the composition of the Opus/Redaction;Text that took information or ideas from the Opus/Redaction

objectProperty.name: hasCreator
objectProperty.label: Do you know who wrote this work?
objectProperty.desc: This property points to one of the persons (an instance of Person) who has created the current cultural product under analysis

objectProperty.name: isDerivedFrom
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the text under analysis (Redaction) which has been a source for the current cultural product

objectProperty.name: isDerivedFrom
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the text under analysis (Apparatus) which has been a source for the current cultural product

objectProperty.name: isDerivedFrom
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the work under analysis (Opus) which has been a source for the current cultural product

objectProperty.name: isSource
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the text under analysis (Redaction) from which the current cultural product has derived

objectProperty.name: isSource
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the text under analysis (Apparatus) from which the current cultural product has derived

objectProperty.name: isSource
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the work under analysis (Opus) from which the current cultural product has derived

objectProperty.name: hasRelationsWith
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the text under analysis (Redaction) with which the current cultural product has a generic intertextual relationship

objectProperty.name: hasRelationsWith
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the text under analysis (Apparatus) with which the current cultural product has a generic intertextual relationship

objectProperty.name: hasRelationsWith
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the work under analysis (Opus) with which the current cultural product has a generic intertextual relationship

objectProperty.name: hasContemporaryRelation
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the work under analysis (Redaction) with which the current cultural product, that is contemporary to it, has some kind of intertextual relationship

objectProperty.name: hasContemporaryRelation
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the work under analysis (Opus) with which the current cultural product, that is contemporary to it, has some kind of intertextual relationship

objectProperty.name: hasContemporaryRelation
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the work under analysis (Apparatus) with which the current cultural product, that is contemporary to it, has some kind of intertextual relationship

dataProperty.name: title
dataProperty.label: Title
dataProperty.desc: An identifying name given to a text or tune

dataProperty.name: incipit
dataProperty.label: Incipit
dataProperty.desc: The first line of the work

dataProperty.name: typeOfIntertextuality
dataProperty.label: Type of work according to intertextuality
dataProperty.desc: Categorisation of the work under analysis depending on the relationship between this work and other texts. E.g. “contrafactum”, “de seguir”, etc.

dataProperty.name: description
dataProperty.label: Description
dataProperty.desc: A statement or an account characterising something

dataProperty.name: location
dataProperty.label: Location
dataProperty.desc: The particular position of a piece of information in a text

dataProperty.name: reference
dataProperty.label: Reference
dataProperty.desc: A non-structured mention of a textual source

dataProperty.name: referenceLocation
dataProperty.label: Reference location
dataProperty.desc: The location of the relevant piece of information in that particular textual source

dataProperty.name: rubric
dataProperty.label: Rubric
dataProperty.desc: Initial prose that introduces a verse composition (it usually suggests its theme). In some traditions, rubrics might appear at the end of the poem

dataProperty.name: sampleText
dataProperty.label: Sample text
dataProperty.desc: Excerpt

dataProperty.name: summary
dataProperty.label: Summary
dataProperty.desc: Abstract, synopsis, brief outline

dataProperty.name: url
dataProperty.label: URL
dataProperty.desc: Reference to a web resource that specifies its location on a computer network and a mechanism for retrieving it

dataProperty.name: notes
dataProperty.label: Notes
dataProperty.desc: Comment or explanations

class.name: Line
class.desc: A unit of verse that usually ends in a visual or typographic break and generally characterized by its length and meter “As armas e os barões assinalados” - from Os Lusíadas

objectProperty.name: hasFirstPart
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the first division of the line (an instance of Line), such as the first hemistich

objectProperty.name: isFirstPart
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the container (an instance of Line) of which the current item under analysis is its first part

objectProperty.name: isFirstLine
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the group of lines (an instance of Stanza) of which the current item under analysis is its first line

objectProperty.name: isFirstLine
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the group of lines (an instance of Stanza) of which the current item under analysis is its first line

objectProperty.name: nextPart
objectProperty.desc: When a line is divided in smaller units, such as hemistichs, this property points to next division (an instance of Line)

objectProperty.name: previousPart
objectProperty.desc: When a line is divided in smaller units, such as hemistichs, this property points to previous division (an instance of Line)

objectProperty.name: hasFirstToken
objectProperty.label: Do you want to segment the line into words/punctuation signs? If so, point to the first token if this is a word
objectProperty.desc: This property points to one of the words (an instance of Word) which form the current element under analysis

objectProperty.name: hasFirstToken
objectProperty.label: Do you want to segment the line into words/punctuation signs? If so, point to the first token if this is a punctuation
objectProperty.desc: This property points to one of the words (an instance of Punctuation) which form the current element under analysis

objectProperty.name: isAnalysedThrough
objectProperty.label: Do you want to insert information about the prosodic analysis of the line?
objectProperty.desc: This property points to an item (LinePattern) that contains analytical content about the current instance of Line

objectProperty.name: hasFirstSyllable
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the first syllable (an instance of Syllable) of the line

objectProperty.name: isAnalysedThrough
objectProperty.label: Do you want to link the apparatus analysis to the line?
objectProperty.desc: This property points to an item (Apparatus) that contains analytical content about the current instance of Line

objectProperty.name: mentions
objectProperty.desc: This property points to an instance of Word to provide further information of a word referred in the Apparatus

objectProperty.name: mentions
objectProperty.label: Does this line mention any persons?
objectProperty.desc: This property points to an instance of Person that is referred in the current under analysis

objectProperty.name: mentions
objectProperty.label: Does this line mention any places?
objectProperty.desc: This property points to an instance of Place that is referred in the current under analysis

objectProperty.name: mentions
objectProperty.label: Does this text mention any organisations?
objectProperty.desc: This property points to an instance of Organisation that is referred in the current under analysis

objectProperty.name: nextLine
objectProperty.label: Do you want to insert information about the next line?
objectProperty.desc: This property points to an instance of Line that follows the current item under analysis

objectProperty.name: previousLine
objectProperty.desc: This property points to an instance of Line that preceeds the current item under analysis

objectProperty.name: presents
objectProperty.label: Do you want to define the figures of speech of this line?
objectProperty.desc: This propery points to an instance of FigureOfSpeech that is contained in the current item under analysis

objectProperty.name: hasRelationWith
objectProperty.desc: This propery points to the instance of FigureOfSpeech which defines the relation between the Line under analysis an a another instance of Line

objectProperty.name: presents
objectProperty.label: Do you want to define the rhyme of this line?
objectProperty.desc: This propery points to an instance of Rhyme that is contained in the current item under analysis

objectProperty.name: hasRhymeMatchCall
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the instance of RhymeMatch that contains the analysis of a rhyme word of this line which is a call of other rhymes

objectProperty.name: hasRhymeMatchEcho
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the instance of RhymeMatch that contains the analysis of a rhyme word of this line which is the echo of a rhyme

objectProperty.name: rhymesWith
objectProperty.label: Do you want to point to another line that rhymes with this one?
objectProperty.desc: This propery points to an instance of Line that rhymes with the current Line under analysis

dataProperty.name: lineNumber
dataProperty.label: Line number
dataProperty.desc: Number of the verse

dataProperty.name: nextPageNumber
dataProperty.label: Number of the next page
dataProperty.desc: If this is the last line of a page in the source, number of the following page (otherwise leave empty)

dataProperty.name: nextColumnLabel
dataProperty.label: Label of the next column
dataProperty.desc: If this is the last line of a column in the source, label or number of the following column (otherwise leave empty)

dataProperty.name: content
dataProperty.label: Content
dataProperty.desc: Full content of item

dataProperty.name: regularisedSpelling
dataProperty.label: Regularised spelling
dataProperty.desc: Contains a reading which has been regularized or normalized regarding its orthography

dataProperty.name: isRefrain
dataProperty.label: Is this item part of a refrain?
dataProperty.desc: Whether the line or group of lines is part of a refrain

dataProperty.name: notes
dataProperty.label: Notes
dataProperty.desc: Comment or explanations

class.name: LinePattern
class.desc: The prosodic analysis using a Line as the unit of reference The number of syllables of the Line

objectProperty.name: analyses
objectProperty.desc: This propery points to an instance of Line about which the item at hand presents analytical information

objectProperty.name: analyses
objectProperty.desc: This propery points to an instance of Redaction about which the item at hand presents analytical information

objectProperty.name: hasFirstFoot
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the first Foot of the line

objectProperty.name: uses
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the instance of MetricalEncoding in which the conventions implemented in the item at hand are explained

dataProperty.name: isHypermetre
dataProperty.label: Is it hypermetre?
dataProperty.desc: It has one or more syllables in addition to those found in a standard metrical unit or line of verse

dataProperty.name: isHypometre
dataProperty.label: Is it hypometre?
dataProperty.desc: It has one or more syllables less than to those found in a standard metrical unit or line of verse

dataProperty.name: isRegular
dataProperty.label: Is it regular?
dataProperty.desc: Regular metrics

dataProperty.name: phoneticTranscription
dataProperty.label: Phonetic transcription
dataProperty.desc: Phonetic transcription

dataProperty.name: rhythmicalNotation
dataProperty.label: Rhythmical notation
dataProperty.desc: Notation based on the distribution of weak and strong positions for rhythmical purposes. Specially meant for non-accentual/quantitative versification

dataProperty.name: accentualMetricalScheme
dataProperty.label: Accentual metrical scheme
dataProperty.desc: Metrical scheme for quantitative, accentual or accentual-syllabic metre. The difference between this property and rhythmicalNotation is that in this scheme feet boundaries are expected

dataProperty.name: altAccentualMetricalScheme
dataProperty.label: Accentual metrical scheme (alternative analysis)
dataProperty.desc: Distribution of stresses/long syllables, but, for instance, with the addition of / marks for word boundaries in the line

dataProperty.name: syllabicMetricalScheme
dataProperty.label: Syllabic metrical scheme
dataProperty.desc: Metrical scheme according to the number of syllables

dataProperty.name: altSyllabicMetricalScheme
dataProperty.label: Syllabic metrical scheme (alternative analysis)
dataProperty.desc: Alternative metrical schema (e.g. long lines with caesura opposite to short lines)

dataProperty.name: numberOfSyllables
dataProperty.label: Number of syllables
dataProperty.desc: The exact number of syllables, that is, without paying attention to any metrical phenomena that may affect the counting

dataProperty.name: accentedVowels
dataProperty.label: Accented vowels
dataProperty.desc: Stressed vowels in the order in which they occur in the text

dataProperty.name: accentedVowelsPattern
dataProperty.label: Pattern of accented vowels
dataProperty.desc: Stressed vowels in a line, in alpha order to show sound repetitions

dataProperty.name: scannedLine
dataProperty.label: Scanned line
dataProperty.desc: A line metrically analysed, marked up in terms of syllable division and accent

dataProperty.name: clausula
dataProperty.label: Clausula/Rhyme gender
dataProperty.desc: The rhythmic ending of a line determined by the number of unstressed syllables following the last stressed one. This property is both valid for accentual and syllabic versification, so possible values include: masculine (zero syllables), femenine (one), dactylic, proparoxitone, etc.

dataProperty.name: feetType
dataProperty.label: Feet type
dataProperty.desc: Categorisation according to the type of feet (eg. iambic tetrameter)

dataProperty.name: footType
dataProperty.label: Foot type
dataProperty.desc: Type of foot (e.g. iamb)

dataProperty.name: numberOfFeet
dataProperty.label: Number of feet
dataProperty.desc: Number of feet

dataProperty.name: grammaticalStressPattern
dataProperty.label: Grammatical stress pattern
dataProperty.desc: Pattern based on disposition of the expected stresses according to grammar rules. This includes the distribution of weak and strong positions

dataProperty.name: phonemePattern
dataProperty.label: Phoneme pattern
dataProperty.desc: All phonemes in a line represented by their nearest written equivalents. They could be arranged in alpha order to show sound repetitions

dataProperty.name: phonemePatternByManner
dataProperty.label: Phoneme pattern by manner
dataProperty.desc: All phonemes in a line represented by manner of articulation. They could be arranged in alpha order to show sound repetitions. The coding scheme presented in one of the databases stands for the different manners of articulation of consonants, and at the same time groups together front and back vowels

dataProperty.name: initialPhonemesPattern
dataProperty.label: Pattern of initial phonemes
dataProperty.desc: Initial phonemes of each word in a line, in alpha order to show sound repetitions

dataProperty.name: initialPhonemesPatternByManner
dataProperty.label: Pattern of initial phonemes by manner
dataProperty.desc: Initial phonemes of each word in a line represented by manner, in alpha order to show sound repetitions

dataProperty.name: numberOfEvenStressedSyllables
dataProperty.label: Number of even stressed syllables
dataProperty.desc: Number of stressed even syllables

dataProperty.name: numberOfOddStressedSyllables
dataProperty.label: Number of odd stressed syllables
dataProperty.desc: Number of stressed odd syllables

dataProperty.name: vowelTypeScheme
dataProperty.label: Vowel type scheme
dataProperty.desc: Linguistic properties of the vowels of the line

dataProperty.name: hasAnacrusis
dataProperty.label: Does it have an anacrusis?
dataProperty.desc: Line with one or more unstressed syllables at the beginning of a line of verse, before the reckoning of the normal meter begins

dataProperty.name: hasCaesura
dataProperty.label: Does it have a caesura?
dataProperty.desc: Line with a pause/break near its middle

dataProperty.name: hasDiaeresis
dataProperty.label: Does it have any diaereses?
dataProperty.desc: It presents a break or pause in a line of verse that occurs when the end of a word and the end of a metrical foot coincide

dataProperty.name: hasDiastole
dataProperty.label: Does it have any diastoles?
dataProperty.desc: It contains the lengthening of a normally short syllable

dataProperty.name: hasElision
dataProperty.label: Does it have any elisions?
dataProperty.desc: It presents the combination of two syllables into one for the purposes of poetic scansion

dataProperty.name: hasHiatus
dataProperty.label: Does it have any hiatuses?
dataProperty.desc: It contains the separate pronunciation of the two vowels in a diphthong for the sake of meter

dataProperty.name: hasProsthesis
dataProperty.label: Does it have any prostheses?
dataProperty.desc: It presents the addition of a sound or syllable at the beginning of a word

dataProperty.name: hasSynizesis
dataProperty.label: Does it have any synizeses?
dataProperty.desc: It presents the union in pronunciation of two adjacent vowels into one syllable

dataProperty.name: hasSystole
dataProperty.label: Does it have any systoles?
dataProperty.desc: It contains the shortening of a syllable regularly long

dataProperty.name: hasEnjambment
dataProperty.label: Does it have an enjambment?
dataProperty.desc: Whether this line has an enjambment

dataProperty.name: enjambmentDescription
dataProperty.label: Type of enjambment/enjambment description
dataProperty.desc: Description of the enjambment

dataProperty.name: metricalNotes
dataProperty.label: Metrical notes
dataProperty.desc: Metrical commentary

dataProperty.name: notes
dataProperty.label: Notes
dataProperty.desc: Comment or explanations

class.name: Foot
class.desc: A unit of poetic meter consisting of stressed and unstressed syllables or long and short syllables in any of various set combinations

objectProperty.name: isFirstFoot
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the LinePattern whose feet description begins with the current item under analysis

objectProperty.name: hasFirstUnit
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the firt unit in which the foot is divided (an instance of FootDivision)

objectProperty.name: nextFoot
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the next instance of Foot

objectProperty.name: nextFootAfterCaesura
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the next instance of Foot when this is positioned after a caesura

objectProperty.name: previousFoot
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the previous instance of Foot

objectProperty.name: previousFootBeforeCaesura
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the previous instance of Foot when this is positioned before a caesura

dataProperty.name: footType
dataProperty.label: Foot type
dataProperty.desc: Type of foot (e.g. iamb)

dataProperty.name: syllabicScheme
dataProperty.label: Syllabic scheme
dataProperty.desc: Abstraction to represent the type of syllables. Eg. “ox(o)“

dataProperty.name: isIrregular
dataProperty.label: Is it irregular?
dataProperty.desc: Whether in comparison to the other lines, the current foot breaks a regular pattern

dataProperty.name: isHypermetrical
dataProperty.label: Is it hypermetrical?
dataProperty.desc: Whether the instance at hand is the last foot of the line or hemistich and it contains extra syllables

dataProperty.name: isCatalectic
dataProperty.label: Is it catalectic?
dataProperty.desc: Whether the instance at hand is the last foot of the line or hemistich and is lacking one syllable

dataProperty.name: numberOfMorae
dataProperty.label: Number of morae
dataProperty.desc: The number of morae the foot contains

dataProperty.name: clausula
dataProperty.label: Clausula
dataProperty.desc: The rhythmic ending of a line determined by the number of unstressed syllables following the last stressed one. Eg. femenine (one syllable), dactylic (two syllables), etc.

class.name: FootDivision
class.desc: Unit smaller than Foot

objectProperty.name: isFirstUnit
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the Foot that contains the item at hand as its first element

objectProperty.name: previousUnit
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the previous unit that forms the foot (an instance of FootDivision)

objectProperty.name: nextUnit
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the next unit that forms the foot (an instance of FootDivision)

dataProperty.name: unitType
dataProperty.label: Type of unit
dataProperty.desc: The type of unit that

dataProperty.name: scheme
dataProperty.label: Scheme
dataProperty.desc: Abstraction that represents the outline of the unit through a pattern

class.name: Location
class.desc: The particular position of a piece of information in a text

objectProperty.name: references
objectProperty.desc: This property points to a Word that is mentioned in a specific point of a bibliographic, that is, the current instance of Location (which is, most likely, a dictionary)

objectProperty.name: references
objectProperty.desc: This property points to a Stanza that is mentioned in a specific point of a bibliographic, that is, the current instance of Location

objectProperty.name: edits
objectProperty.desc: This property points to an instance of Redaction for which the item at hand contains an edition

objectProperty.name: edits
objectProperty.desc: This property points to an instance of Opus for which the item at hand contains an edition

objectProperty.name: edits
objectProperty.desc: This property points to an instance of Witness for which the item at hand contains an edition

objectProperty.name: edits
objectProperty.desc: This property points to an instance of WitnessCollection for which the item at hand contains an edition

objectProperty.name: edits
objectProperty.desc: This property points to an instance of Stanza for which the item at hand contains an edition

objectProperty.name: providesText
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the Redaction whose text was copied from a specific point of a bibliographic item, that is, the current instance of Location

objectProperty.name: catalogues
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the PrimarySource that is indexed or catalogued in the bibliographic item at hand, that is, the current instance of BibliographicSource

objectProperty.name: references
objectProperty.desc: This property points to a Opus that is mentioned a specific point of a bibliographic, that is, the current instance of Location

objectProperty.name: references
objectProperty.desc: This property points to a Person that is mentioned a specific point of a bibliographic, that is, the current instance of Location

objectProperty.name: references
objectProperty.desc: This property points to a Redaction that is mentioned a specific point of a bibliographic, that is, the current instance of Location

objectProperty.name: references
objectProperty.desc: This property points to a StanzaPattern that is mentioned a specific point of a bibliographic, that is, the current instance of Location

objectProperty.name: references
objectProperty.desc: This property points to a WorkPattern that is mentioned a specific point of a bibliographic, that is, the current instance of Location

objectProperty.name: refersAsPart
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the BibliographicSource of which the current instance of Location defines a section

dataProperty.name: identifier
dataProperty.label: Identifier
dataProperty.desc: Supplies any form of identifier used to associate some object

dataProperty.name: location
dataProperty.label: Location
dataProperty.desc: The particular position of a piece of information in a text

dataProperty.name: url
dataProperty.label: URL
dataProperty.desc: Reference to a web resource that specifies its location on a computer network and a mechanism for retrieving it

dataProperty.name: workNumber
dataProperty.label: Work number (poem/song numerical identifier)
dataProperty.desc: Number of the work in the PrimarySource or edition

class.name: Melody
class.desc: A tune

objectProperty.name: hasCreator
objectProperty.label: Do you know who composed this melody?
objectProperty.desc: This property points to one of the persons (an instance of Person) who has created the current Melody under analysis

objectProperty.name: hasInferredCreator
objectProperty.label: In case the composer is not certain, do you or the academia have an hypothesis about who the composer is?
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the Person who the scholars believe to be the author of the current instance of the Melody

objectProperty.name: hasLyrics
objectProperty.desc: This property points to an instance of WitnessCollection whose music is provided by the Melody at hand

objectProperty.name: hasLyrics
objectProperty.desc: This property points to an instance of Redaction whose music is provided by the Melody at hand

objectProperty.name: isEditedIn
objectProperty.label: Is this melody edited in a bibliographic item?
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the bibliographic item (BibliographicSource) that contains an edition of the current instance of Melody

objectProperty.name: isReferencedIn
objectProperty.label: Is this melody referenced in a bibliographic Item?
objectProperty.desc: This property points to a bibliographic item (an instance of BibliographicSource) whose contents are related to the current item under analysis (usually, its specific bibliography)

objectProperty.name: isTheMusic
objectProperty.desc: This property points to an instance of Opus whose music is provided by the Melody at hand

objectProperty.name: hasMusicalNotation
objectProperty.desc: This property points to an instance of MusicalNotation which contents a transcription of the melody

objectProperty.name: isUsedIn
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the sonc/act (an instance of Performance) in which the current Melody is performed

dataProperty.name: title
dataProperty.label: Title
dataProperty.desc: An identifying name given to a text or tune

dataProperty.name: altTitle
dataProperty.label: Alternative title
dataProperty.desc: Alternative name, other known denominations of a text or tune

dataProperty.name: date
dataProperty.label: Date
dataProperty.desc: A particular point or period of time at which something happened or existed, or is expected to happen

dataProperty.name: notAfter
dataProperty.label: Not after (date)
dataProperty.desc: In uncertain dates, it specifies the latest possible date

dataProperty.name: notBefore
dataProperty.label: Not before (date)
dataProperty.desc: In uncertain dates, it specifies the earliest possible date

dataProperty.name: dateNote
dataProperty.label: Notes about the datation
dataProperty.desc: Comments in relation to a stated date

dataProperty.name: scheme
dataProperty.label: Melody scheme
dataProperty.desc: Abstraction that represents the outline of the melody through a pattern

dataProperty.name: transmission
dataProperty.label: Transmission history
dataProperty.desc: Transmission history

dataProperty.name: notes
dataProperty.label: Notes
dataProperty.desc: Comment or explanations

dataProperty.name: audio
dataProperty.label: Audio content
dataProperty.desc: Sound recording that reproduces the melody

dataProperty.name: tonality
dataProperty.label: Tonality
dataProperty.desc: Arrangement of pitches and/or chords of a musical work

class.name: MusicalNotation
class.desc: System used to represent a tune through the use of written symbols

objectProperty.name: represents
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the Melody related to the current instance of MusicalNotation

objectProperty.name: represents
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the Stanza related to the current instance of MusicalNotation

objectProperty.name: represents
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the Melody related to the current instance of MusicalNotation

objectProperty.name: interprets
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the Witness which was the base for the current instance of MusicalNotation

objectProperty.name: interprets
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the PrimarySource which was the base for the current instance of MusicalNotation

objectProperty.name: isTranscribedBy
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the Person who notated this musical piece (the current instance of MusicalNotation)

objectProperty.name: isUsedIn
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the musical piece (an instance of Performance) which follows the MusicalNotation at hand

objectProperty.name: nextTranscription
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the next instance of MusicalNotation

objectProperty.name: previousTranscription
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the previous instance of MusicalNotation

dataProperty.name: typeOfMusicalNotation
dataProperty.label: Type of musical notation
dataProperty.desc: Type of musical notation (palaeographic, alphanumeric, modern...)

dataProperty.name: textualTranscription
dataProperty.label: Textual transcription
dataProperty.desc: Transcription of the musical notation using strings

dataProperty.name: imageOftranscription
dataProperty.label: Image of transcription
dataProperty.desc: Image with the music notation

dataProperty.name: firstsStaves
dataProperty.label: First lines of stave
dataProperty.desc: First lines of the stave of the musical notation

dataProperty.name: editionNotes
dataProperty.label: Edition notes
dataProperty.desc: Editorial commentary

dataProperty.name: originalTypeOfMusicalNotation
dataProperty.label: Type of the original musical notation
dataProperty.desc: Type of musical notation of the PrimarySource

class.name: MetricalEncoding
class.desc: The notation employed to represent a metrical pattern. E.g.: the definition of the plus sign to encode strong positions

objectProperty.name: isUsedBy
objectProperty.desc: This propery points to an instance of WorkPattern which uses the convention defined in the current instance of MetricalEncoding

objectProperty.name: isUsedBy
objectProperty.desc: This propery points to an instance of StanzaPattern which uses the convention defined in the current instance of MetricalEncoding

objectProperty.name: isUsedBy
objectProperty.desc: This propery points to an instance of LinePattern which uses the convention defined in the current instance of MetricalEncoding

dataProperty.name: metricalNotes
dataProperty.label: Metrical notes
dataProperty.desc: Metrical commentary

dataProperty.name: metricalSymbol
dataProperty.label: Symbol used
dataProperty.desc: Symbol use to define a feature in a metrical pattern

dataProperty.name: metricalSymbolExplanation
dataProperty.label: Explanation of symbol
dataProperty.desc: Meaning of the symbol used in a metrical pattern

class.name: Illustration
class.desc: A small portrait, picture, or decorative letter on an illuminated manuscript. Any illustration of a printed material

objectProperty.name: illustrates
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the text, that is, the instance of Redaction

objectProperty.name: isContainedIn
objectProperty.desc: This property points to an intance of Witness to which the current Illustration belongs

objectProperty.name: isContainedIn
objectProperty.desc: This property points to an intance of WitnessCollection to which the current Illustration belongs

objectProperty.name: depicts
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the Scene related to the current item at hand

dataProperty.name: location
dataProperty.label: Location
dataProperty.desc: The particular position of a piece of information in a text

dataProperty.name: caption
dataProperty.label: Caption of illustration/miniature
dataProperty.desc: Transcription of the caption of the miniature/illustration

dataProperty.name: altCaption
dataProperty.label: Alternative caption of illustration/miniature
dataProperty.desc: Normalised/translated caption of the illustration/miniature

dataProperty.name: description
dataProperty.label: Description of illustration/miniature
dataProperty.desc: Description of the illustration/miniature

dataProperty.name: url
dataProperty.label: URL
dataProperty.desc: Reference to a web resource that specifies its location on a computer network and a mechanism for retrieving it

class.name: Opus
class.desc: Abstract concept of an artistic creation. In POSTDATA these creations must be in verse (poem, play, song) Os Lusíadas by Luis Vaz de Camões; La Commedia by Dante; the poem Ad te deus by an Anonymous author written in between the 7th and 9th centuries

objectProperty.name: comesFrom
objectProperty.label: Do you know the provenance (as in a geographical place) of the work?
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the Place which is the provenance of the current instance of Opus

objectProperty.name: hasCreator
objectProperty.label: Is the author using a pseudonym or an heteronym?
objectProperty.desc: This property points to one of the names (an instance of Denomination) to which the authorship of the work under analysis is related

objectProperty.name: hasCreator
objectProperty.label: Do you know who wrote this work?
objectProperty.desc: This property points to one of the persons (an instance of Person) who has created the current work under analysis

objectProperty.name: hasDubiousCreator
objectProperty.label: Is the authorship dubious?
objectProperty.desc: This property points to one of the persons (an instance of Person) who is likely to be the author of work under analysis

objectProperty.name: hasInferredCreator
objectProperty.label: In case the author is not certain, do you or the academia have an hypothesis about who the author is?
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the Person who the scholars believe to be the author of the current instance of the Opus

objectProperty.name: hasMusic
objectProperty.label: Does this work have a melody?
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the instance of Melody that provides the musical contents of the work under analysis (Opus)

objectProperty.name: hasTranslator
objectProperty.label: If this work is a translation, do you know who has translated it?
objectProperty.desc: This property points to one of the persons (an instance of Person) who has translated the work under analysis

objectProperty.name: isAssignedTo
objectProperty.label: Is there paratextual information that assigns the authorship?
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the name (an instance of Denomination) which is said to be the author of the current Opus (likely a wrong attribution)

objectProperty.name: isEditedIn
objectProperty.label: Does this work have previous editions?
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the bibliographic item (BibliographicSource) that contains an edition of the current instance of Opus

objectProperty.name: isEditedIn
objectProperty.desc: This property points to a particular section of a bibliographic item (an instance of Location) that contains an edition of the work under analysis (usually, the specific location of a bibliographic reference)

objectProperty.name: isPart
objectProperty.label: Does this work belong to a collection?
objectProperty.desc: This propery points to the instance of Ensemble to which the Opus at hand belongs

objectProperty.name: isRealisedThrough
objectProperty.label: Do you want to introduce information about the analysis of the text(s)?
objectProperty.desc: This property points to a text (an instance of Redaction) which is one of the materialisations of the work under analysis

objectProperty.name: isReferencedIn
objectProperty.label: Does this work have specific bibliography?
objectProperty.desc: This property points to a bibliographic item (an instance of BibliographicSource) whose contents are related to the current item under analysis (usually, its specific bibliography)

objectProperty.name: isReferencedIn
objectProperty.desc: This property points to a particular section of a bibliographic item (an instance of Location) whose contents are related to the current item under analysis (usually, the specific location of a bibliographic reference)

objectProperty.name: isTranslation
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the reference (and instance of BibliographicSource) that is the orignal version of the current work under analysis

objectProperty.name: isTranslated
objectProperty.label: Has this work been translated as a work that you are analysing?
objectProperty.desc: This property points to another work (an instance of Opus) which is a translation of the current item being analysed

objectProperty.name: isTranslation
objectProperty.label: Is this work a translation of another work you are analysing?
objectProperty.desc: This property points to another work (an instance of Opus) from which the current item being analysed was translated

objectProperty.name: hasCharacter
objectProperty.label: Do you want to provide information about the characters/roles? You can also define them later when analysing the text(s) itself.
objectProperty.desc: This property points to an instance of Role which contains analytical information about one of the characters depicted in the work under analysis

objectProperty.name: usesAsSource
objectProperty.label: Is this work derived from a previous work?
objectProperty.desc: This property points to a cultural product (Intertextuality) which was a source for the work under analysis

objectProperty.name: hasRelationsWith
objectProperty.label: Has this work any type of relations to other Works that can’t be described by the previous questions?
objectProperty.desc: This property points to a cultural product (Intertextuality) which has a generic intertextual relationship with the work under analysis

objectProperty.name: hasContemporaryRelation
objectProperty.label: Is this work related to other works from the same period?
objectProperty.desc: This property points to a cultural product (Intertextuality) which is contemporary to the work under analysis and some kind of intertextual relationship is detected

objectProperty.name: hasDerivedWork
objectProperty.label: Has this work influenced future literary pieces?
objectProperty.desc: This property points to a cultural product (Intertextuality) which was based on the work under analysis

objectProperty.name: isFirstWork
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the container (an instance of Ensemble) of which the current item under analysis is its first work

objectProperty.name: nextWork
objectProperty.desc: This property points to an instance of Opus that follows the current item under analysis

objectProperty.name: previousWork
objectProperty.desc: This property points to an instance of Opus that preceeds the current item under analysis

dataProperty.name: setting
dataProperty.label: Setting
dataProperty.desc: Location of the narrative

dataProperty.name: title
dataProperty.label: Title
dataProperty.desc: An identifying name given to a text or tune

dataProperty.name: subtitle
dataProperty.label: Subtitle
dataProperty.desc: A secondary, usually explanatory title

dataProperty.name: originalTitle
dataProperty.label: Original title
dataProperty.desc: The identifying name of a text or tune as it appears in its PrimarySource

dataProperty.name: altTitle
dataProperty.label: Alternative title
dataProperty.desc: Alternative name, other known denominations of a text or tune

dataProperty.name: language
dataProperty.label: Language
dataProperty.desc: Language of the text

dataProperty.name: domain
dataProperty.label: Literary domain
dataProperty.desc: The literary tradition assigned to a composition

dataProperty.name: literaryPeriod
dataProperty.label: Literary period
dataProperty.desc: Label of a timeframe to group together certain works. Cfr. “school”

dataProperty.name: date
dataProperty.label: Date
dataProperty.desc: A particular point or period of time at which something happened or existed, or is expected to happen

dataProperty.name: dateNote
dataProperty.label: Notes about the datation
dataProperty.desc: Comments in relation to a stated date

dataProperty.name: from
dataProperty.label: From (date range)
dataProperty.desc: Start date of a time-interval. In a closed-range interval it is used with to in order to define the range

dataProperty.name: to
dataProperty.label: To (date range)
dataProperty.desc: End date of a time-interval. In a closed-range interval it is used with from in order to define the range

dataProperty.name: notAfter
dataProperty.label: Not after (date)
dataProperty.desc: In uncertain dates, it specifies the latest possible date

dataProperty.name: notBefore
dataProperty.label: Not before (date)
dataProperty.desc: In uncertain dates, it specifies the earliest possible date

dataProperty.name: isCalligram
dataProperty.label: is it a calligram?
dataProperty.desc: A calligram is a text visually arranged in a way that it forms an image associated with the text’s contents

dataProperty.name: audienceEducationLevel
dataProperty.label: Audience level of education
dataProperty.desc: Level of education of the recipients of a text/song

dataProperty.name: authorEducationLevel
dataProperty.label: Author level of education
dataProperty.desc: Level of education of the creator of a text/song (this property has Domain Opus and not Person since the education level of a person changes during time. This is the education level of the author in the moment of writing the poem)

dataProperty.name: commentary
dataProperty.label: Commentary
dataProperty.desc: An explanatory series of notes or comments; an explanatory essay or treatise on a text

dataProperty.name: poeticType
dataProperty.label: Poetic type
dataProperty.desc: Major literary genre of the composition, that is, drama or poetry

dataProperty.name: genre
dataProperty.label: Genre
dataProperty.desc: Type of art, literature or music characterized by a specific form, content and style

dataProperty.name: function
dataProperty.label: Function
dataProperty.desc: Purpose of the PrimarySource (e.g. private or public)

dataProperty.name: isSung
dataProperty.label: Is it sung?
dataProperty.desc: Whether the Redaction was composed to be sung

dataProperty.name: theme
dataProperty.label: Theme
dataProperty.desc: Subject of a text, song or image

dataProperty.name: keyword
dataProperty.label: Keyword
dataProperty.desc: A significant or descriptive word. Usually, a word used as a reference point for finding other words or information

dataProperty.name: summary
dataProperty.label: Summary
dataProperty.desc: Abstract, synopsis, brief outline

dataProperty.name: unidentifiedSource
dataProperty.label: Unidentified source
dataProperty.desc: There are references that mentioned a PrimarySource for the text at hand but the real textual artefact has not been identified

dataProperty.name: notes
dataProperty.label: Notes
dataProperty.desc: Comment or explanations

class.name: Paratext
class.desc: A comment or explanation, which includes marginalia. Any sorrounding text different from the main text. Eg. colophon, dedication...

objectProperty.name: hasCreator
objectProperty.label: Do you know who wrote the paratext information?
objectProperty.desc: This property points to one of the persons (an instance of Person) who has created the current contents under analysis

objectProperty.name: hasPart
objectProperty.desc: This property points to a smaller part of the current Paratext (e.g. an index entry that contains a rubric)

objectProperty.name: isPart
objectProperty.desc: This property points to a Paratext that is the container of the item at hand.

objectProperty.name: providesParatext
objectProperty.label: In relation to the notes present in one of the witnesses, do you want to add information about the witness?
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the instance of Witness that contains the current Paratext

objectProperty.name: providesParatext
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the instance of WitnessCollection that contains the current Paratext

objectProperty.name: providesParatext
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the instance of PrimarySource that contains the current Paratext

objectProperty.name: providesParatext
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the instance of Redaction about which the current Paratext provides information

objectProperty.name: assignsAuthorship
objectProperty.label: Does the index entry specify the authorship in a way that requires further analysis (wrong attribution, alternative names, etc.)
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the name (Denomination) that is said to be the author (it might be a wrong attribution)

objectProperty.name: mentions
objectProperty.label: Does the paratext mention any places?
objectProperty.desc: This property points to a Place that is recorded in the current instance of the Paratext

objectProperty.name: mentions
objectProperty.label: Does the paratext mention any persons?
objectProperty.desc: This property points to a Person that is recorded in the current instance of the Paratext

objectProperty.name: hasRole
objectProperty.desc: This property points to an instance of Role that describes the role somebody carried out according to the paratextual information

dataProperty.name: title
dataProperty.label: Title
dataProperty.desc: An identifying name given to a text or tune

dataProperty.name: mentionedTitle
dataProperty.label: Mentioned title
dataProperty.desc: Title of the work as appears in the paratext (e.g. title according to a index entry)

dataProperty.name: editedContent
dataProperty.label: Edited content
dataProperty.desc: Edition of the contents of the paratext

dataProperty.name: originalContent
dataProperty.label: Original content
dataProperty.desc: Transcription of the contents of the paratext

dataProperty.name: date
dataProperty.label: Date
dataProperty.desc: A particular point or period of time at which something happened or existed, or is expected to happen

objectProperty.name: mentions
objectProperty.label: Does this text mention any organisations?
objectProperty.desc: This property points to an instance of Organisation that is referred in the current under analysis

dataProperty.name: typeOfParatext
dataProperty.label: Type of paratext
dataProperty.desc: the type of paratextual information Marginalia, prose with an explanation of the text Colophon, a statement that contains information about the authorship, printer or manuscript transmission of a work Rubric, the heading of the poem

dataProperty.name: location
dataProperty.label: Location
dataProperty.desc: The particular position of a piece of information in a text

dataProperty.name: notes
dataProperty.label: Notes
dataProperty.desc: Comment or explanations

class.name: Person
class.desc: A human being regarded as an individual. This person could have existed in real life or it may be fictional. D. Quijote de la Mancha

objectProperty.name: authorIsEditedIn
objectProperty.label: Are the works by this author edited in a specific item?
objectProperty.desc: This property points to an edition (an instance of BibliographicSource) of the current author under analysis

objectProperty.name: collectsMaterials
objectProperty.desc: This property points to an instance of Witness whose textual contents was collected by the current Person

objectProperty.name: collates
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the text (an instance of Redaction) which is the result of the collation done by the current Person

objectProperty.name: isMentionedIn
objectProperty.desc: This property points to a Person that is recorded in the current instance of the Paratext

objectProperty.name: isPart
objectProperty.label: Does this person belong to an Institution, Organisation, etc?
objectProperty.desc: This propery points to the instance of Organisation to which the Person at hand belongs

objectProperty.name: collectsMaterials
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the artifact (an instance of PrimarySource) whose textual contents was collected by the current Person

objectProperty.name: comesFrom
objectProperty.label: Do you know where the person comes from?
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the Place which is the provenance of the current instance of Person

objectProperty.name: copies
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the artifact (an instance of PrimarySource) whose textual contents were copied by the current Person

objectProperty.name: copies
objectProperty.desc: This property points to a text (an instance of Witness) whose textual contents were copied by the current Person

objectProperty.name: copies
objectProperty.desc: This property points to a set of texts (an instance of WitnessCollection) whose textual contents were copied by the current Person

objectProperty.name: creates
objectProperty.desc: This property points to a work (an instance of Opus) which was authored by the current Person

objectProperty.name: creates
objectProperty.desc: This property points to a work (an instance of PrimarySource) which was authored by the current Person

objectProperty.name: creates
objectProperty.desc: This property points to a bibliographic item (an instance of BibliographicSource) which was authored by the current Person

objectProperty.name: creates
objectProperty.desc: This property points to a cultural product (an instance of Intertextuality) which was authored by the current Person

objectProperty.name: creates
objectProperty.desc: This property points to a collection of works (an instance of Ensemble) which was authored by the current Person

objectProperty.name: creates
objectProperty.desc: This property points to a tune (an instance of Melody) which was authored by the current Person

objectProperty.name: creates
objectProperty.desc: This property points to a group of lines (an instance of Stanza) which was authored by the current Person

objectProperty.name: creates
objectProperty.desc: This property points to a textual content (an instance of Paratext) which was authored by the current Person

objectProperty.name: edits
objectProperty.desc: This property points to an instance of Ensemble which was edited by the the current Person

objectProperty.name: edits
objectProperty.desc: This property points to an instance of WitnessCollection which was edited by the the current Person

objectProperty.name: edits
objectProperty.desc: This property points to an instance of Redaction which was edited by the the current Person

objectProperty.name: edits
objectProperty.desc: This property points to an instance of Stanza which was edited by the the current Person

objectProperty.name: editsAuthor
objectProperty.desc: This property points to an author (instance of Person) who was edited by the the current Person

objectProperty.name: hasOtherDesignation
objectProperty.label: Is this person known by other names?
objectProperty.desc: This property points to a name (an instance of Denomination) by which the current Person is also known

objectProperty.name: hasDedication
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the text (an instance of Redaction) which was dedicated to the current Person

objectProperty.name: authorHasEditor
objectProperty.label: Has this author been edited by a particular scholar?
objectProperty.desc: This property points to one of the persons (an instance of Person) who has edited the work of the under analysis (the current instance of Person)

objectProperty.name: hasRole
objectProperty.desc: This property points to one of the roles (an instance of Role) performend by the current Person

objectProperty.name: informs
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the artifact (an instance of PrimarySource) for whose textual contents the current Person acted as an informant

objectProperty.name: informs
objectProperty.desc: This property points to a text (an instance of Witness) for whose textual contents the current Person acted as an informant

objectProperty.name: informs
objectProperty.desc: This property points to a set of texts (an instance of WitnessCollection) for whose textual contents the current Person acted as an informant

objectProperty.name: isDubiouslyAssignedAsCreator
objectProperty.desc: This property points to a work (an instance of Opus) which was likely authored by the current Person

objectProperty.name: isEditor
objectProperty.desc: This property points to a bibliographic item (an instance of BibliographicSource) which was edited by the current Person

objectProperty.name: makesTranscription
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the music sheet (one or more instances of MusicalNotation) transcribed by the Person at hand

objectProperty.name: isPerformer
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the song/act (Performance) performed by the Person under analysis

objectProperty.name: isPerformer
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the instance of Role performed by the Person under analysis

objectProperty.name: isAssignedAsAuthor
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the Acrostic where the current instance of Person is said to be the author of the work under analysis

objectProperty.name: isAssignedAsAuthor
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the PrimarySource where the current instance of Person is said to be the author of the work under analysis

objectProperty.name: isMentionedIn
objectProperty.desc: This property points to a acrostic (an instance of Acrostic) that records the current item under analysis

objectProperty.name: isMentionedIn
objectProperty.desc: This property points to a acrostic (an instance of Acrostic) that records the current item under analysis

objectProperty.name: isMentionedIn
objectProperty.desc: This property points to a acrostic (an instance of Acrostic) that records the current item under analysis

objectProperty.name: isMentionedIn
objectProperty.desc: This property points to a acrostic (an instance of Acrostic) that records the current item under analysis

objectProperty.name: isReferencedIn
objectProperty.label: Does this person have specific bibliography?
objectProperty.desc: This property points to a bibliographic item (an instance of BibliographicSource) whose contents are related to the current item under analysis (usually, its specific bibliography)

objectProperty.name: isReferencedIn
objectProperty.desc: This property points to a particular section of a bibliographic item (an instance of Location) whose contents are related to the current item under analysis (usually, the specific location of a bibliographic reference)

objectProperty.name: isTranslator
objectProperty.desc: This property points to a bibliographic item (an instance of BibliographicSource) which was translated by the current Person

objectProperty.name: isArranger
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the Performance which is an arrangement (the musical reconceptualisation of a previously composed work)

objectProperty.name: ordersCreation
objectProperty.desc: This property points to an artifact (instance of PrimarySource) which was created by the command of the Person at hand

objectProperty.name: wasOwner
objectProperty.desc: This property points to an artifact (instance of PrimarySource) which at some point was owned by the Person at hand

objectProperty.name: prints
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the artifact (an instance of PrimarySource) which was printed by the current Person

objectProperty.name: translates
objectProperty.desc: This property points to a work (an instance of Opus) which was translated by the current Person

objectProperty.name: translates
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the artifact (an instance of PrimarySource) which was translated by the current Person

objectProperty.name: wasInferredAsCreator
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the Melody which the scholars believe to be the authored by the current instance of Person

objectProperty.name: wasInferredAsCreator
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the Opus which the scholars believe to be the authored by the current instance of Person

dataProperty.name: name
dataProperty.label: Name
dataProperty.desc: Contains a proper noun or noun phrase that refers the current item

dataProperty.name: altName
dataProperty.label: Alternative name
dataProperty.desc: Alternative name that references the current item

dataProperty.name: addName
dataProperty.label: Additional name component
dataProperty.desc: It contains an additional name component, such as a nickname, epithet, or alias, or any other descriptive phrase used within a personal name

dataProperty.name: surname
dataProperty.label: Surname
dataProperty.desc: Contains a family (inherited) name, as opposed to a given, baptismal, or nick name

dataProperty.name: forename
dataProperty.label: Forename
dataProperty.desc: It contains a forename, given or baptismal name

dataProperty.name: nameLink
dataProperty.label: Name link
dataProperty.desc: Contains a connecting phrase or link used within a name but not regarded as part of it, such as van der or of

dataProperty.name: genName
dataProperty.label: Generational title
dataProperty.desc: It contains a name component used to distinguish otherwise similar names on the basis of the relative ages or generations of the persons named

dataProperty.name: roleName
dataProperty.label: Role name
dataProperty.desc: contains a name component which indicates that the referent has a particular role or position in society, such as an official title or rank

dataProperty.name: originalName
dataProperty.label: Original name
dataProperty.desc: Non-normalised name (e.g. name as it appears in a PrimarySource)

dataProperty.name: uri
dataProperty.label: URI
dataProperty.desc: URI to an authority archive, such as the The Virtual International Authority File (VIAF)

dataProperty.name: biography
dataProperty.label: Biography
dataProperty.desc: An account of a person's life written, composed, or produced by another

dataProperty.name: isFictional
dataProperty.label: Is this person a fictional character?
dataProperty.desc: Whether the person under analysis is a fictional character

dataProperty.name: birthDate
dataProperty.label: Date of birth
dataProperty.desc: Date of birth

dataProperty.name: birthDateCertainty
dataProperty.label: Birthdate certainty
dataProperty.desc: Certainty of the date of birth

dataProperty.name: deathDate
dataProperty.label: Date of death
dataProperty.desc: Date of death

dataProperty.name: dateNote
dataProperty.label: Notes about the datation
dataProperty.desc: Comments in relation to a stated date

dataProperty.name: birthPlaceCertainty
dataProperty.label: Birthplace certainty
dataProperty.desc: Certainty of the place of origin

dataProperty.name: nationality
dataProperty.label: Nationality
dataProperty.desc: An ethnic group forming a part of one or more political nations

dataProperty.name: floruitFrom
dataProperty.label: Floruit from
dataProperty.desc: Beginning of a person’s period of activity

dataProperty.name: floruitTo
dataProperty.label: Floruit to
dataProperty.desc: Ending of a person’s period of activity

dataProperty.name: floruit
dataProperty.label: Floruit
dataProperty.desc: A person’s period of activity (to use when a range cannot be stablished; eg. “3rd century”)

dataProperty.name: literaryPeriod
dataProperty.label: Literary period
dataProperty.desc: Label of a timeframe to group together certain works. Cfr. school

dataProperty.name: gender
dataProperty.label: Gender
dataProperty.desc: The gender of the Person

dataProperty.name: isAnonymous
dataProperty.label: Is its identity anonymous?
dataProperty.desc: In case the current instance of Person is linked to the Opus as creator, but his/her identity is unknown

dataProperty.name: notes
dataProperty.label: Notes
dataProperty.desc: Comment or explanations

dataProperty.name: portrait
dataProperty.label: Portrait
dataProperty.desc: URL to a digital image file that depicts the person

dataProperty.name: school
dataProperty.label: School
dataProperty.desc: Literary movement

dataProperty.name: socialStatus
dataProperty.label: Social status
dataProperty.desc: The social status of the Person, that is the position or rank of a Person within the society

dataProperty.name: sourceNote
dataProperty.label: Source note
dataProperty.desc: Note about the source used to give a particular piece of information

class.name: Performance
class.desc: A song, the representation of a play

objectProperty.name: hasArranger
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the Person who made the arrangement, that is the musical reconceptualisation of a previously composed work

objectProperty.name: hasPerformer
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the Person who performs the song

objectProperty.name: hasMusicalNotation
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the MusicalNotation followed in the Performance at hand

objectProperty.name: wasRecordedIn

objectProperty.name: hasMusic

objectProperty.name: hasLyrics
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the text (an instance of Redaction) used in the current Performance

objectProperty.name: hasCharacter
objectProperty.desc: This property points to an instance of Role to describe the characters

objectProperty.name: wasPerformedIn
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the Place where the current performance took place

dataProperty.name: date
dataProperty.label: Date
dataProperty.desc: A particular point or period of time at which something happened or existed, or is expected to happen

dataProperty.name: audio
dataProperty.label: Audio content
dataProperty.desc: Sound recording that reproduces the song/play

dataProperty.name: video
dataProperty.label: Video content
dataProperty.desc: Video file that reproduces the song/play

dataProperty.name: tempo
dataProperty.label: Tempo
dataProperty.desc: The speed or pace of a performance

dataProperty.name: time
dataProperty.label: Time/duration
dataProperty.desc: Time/duration of the performance

dataProperty.name: syllablesPerMinute
dataProperty.label: Number of syllables per minute
dataProperty.desc: Number of syllables uttered per minute in the current performance

class.name: Place
class.desc: A particular position, point, or area in space; a location

objectProperty.name: hasItem
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the Place where the current Repository is located

objectProperty.name: isMentionedIn
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the Acrostic in which the current instance of Place is referenced

objectProperty.name: isMentionedIn
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the Line in which the current instance of Place is referenced

objectProperty.name: isMentionedIn
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the Paratext in which the current instance of Place is referenced

objectProperty.name: isMentionedIn
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the Event in which the current instance of Place is referenced

objectProperty.name: isMentionedIn
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the Redaction in which the current instance of Place is referenced

objectProperty.name: isTheOrigin
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the Opus whose provenance corresponds to the current instance of Place

objectProperty.name: isTheOrigin
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the Person whose provenance corresponds to the current instance of Place

objectProperty.name: isTheOrigin
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the PrimarySource whose provenance corresponds to the current instance of Place

objectProperty.name: isTheOrigin
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the Witness whose provenance corresponds to the current instance of Place

objectProperty.name: isTheOrigin
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the WitnessCollection whose provenance corresponds to the current instance of Place

objectProperty.name: isTheOrigin
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the Ensemble whose provenance corresponds to the current instance of Place

objectProperty.name: wasPlaceOfRecording
objectProperty.desc: This property points an instance of Performance which was recorded in the current Place

objectProperty.name: wasSetting
objectProperty.desc: This property points to a Performance that took place in the current element under analysis

dataProperty.name: latitude
dataProperty.label: Latitude
dataProperty.desc: Latitude expressed in decimal degrees (WGS84)

dataProperty.name: longitude
dataProperty.label: Longitude
dataProperty.desc: Longitude expressed in decimal degrees (WGS84)

dataProperty.name: altitude
dataProperty.label: Altitude
dataProperty.desc: Altitude expressed in decimal degrees (WGS84)

dataProperty.name: name
dataProperty.label: Name
dataProperty.desc: Contains the modern/standard name of a place. Use a language tag to define the language

dataProperty.name: originalName
dataProperty.label: Original name
dataProperty.desc: Name of the place as it appears in the source text

dataProperty.name: settlement
dataProperty.label: Settlement
dataProperty.desc: Contains the name of a settlement such as a city, town, or village identified as a single geo-political or administrative unit

dataProperty.name: region
dataProperty.label: Region
dataProperty.desc: Name of the region

dataProperty.name: country
dataProperty.label: Country
dataProperty.desc: Name of the country

dataProperty.name: uri
dataProperty.label: URI
dataProperty.desc: URI to a Linked Open Data resource

dataProperty.name: notes
dataProperty.label: Notes
dataProperty.desc: Comment or explanations

class.name: PrimarySource
class.desc: It is an artefact, a document, autograph, manuscript, a printed book, a stone or other source of information that transmits the Opus. A PrimarySource must be contemporary to the creation of the Opus or, otherwise, the earliest recordings of the Opus which are available.The song Ondas do Mar de Vigo by Martim Codax has three PrimarySource: two booksongs copied in the 16th century and a piece of parchment from the 13th century

objectProperty.name: belongsTo
objectProperty.label: Does this resource belong to a library, repository, etc?
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the intance of Repository in which the current item is kept

objectProperty.name: comesFrom
objectProperty.label: Do you know where this resource comes from?
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the Place which is the provenance of the current instance of PrimarySource

objectProperty.name: hasCreator
objectProperty.label: Do you know what person(s) authored this Primary Source?
objectProperty.desc: This property points to one of the persons (an instance of Person) who has authored the current instance of the PrimarySource

objectProperty.name: hasCollector
objectProperty.label: Can you provide information about the person(s) who collected the textual materials of this resource?
objectProperty.desc: This property points to one of the persons (an instance of Person) who has collected the materials of the current intance of PrimarySource

objectProperty.name: hasCopyist
objectProperty.label: Do you have information about the copyist(s)?
objectProperty.desc: This property points to one of the persons (an instance of Person) who has participated in the copy of the current intance of PrimarySource

objectProperty.name: hasInformant
objectProperty.label: Do you know who provided the contents of this resource (e.g. informant in oral traditions)
objectProperty.desc: This property points to one of the persons (an instance of Person) who has participated as an informant for the materials of the current intance of PrimarySource

objectProperty.name: hasPart
objectProperty.desc: This property points to one of the witnesses (a instance of Witness) that form the current instance of the PrimarySource

objectProperty.name: hasPart
objectProperty.label: Is this resource divided in different sections (e.g different booksongs in the same compilation)
objectProperty.desc: This property points to one of the distinct manuscripts or parts of a manuscript (a instance of WitnessCollection) when the current instance of the PrimarySource is a composite manuscript. It might also point to any subdivision of the current instance of the PrimarySource

objectProperty.name: hasItem
objectProperty.desc: This property points to an instance of paratextual information (Paratext) contained by the PrimarySource at hand

objectProperty.name: hasPrinter
objectProperty.label: Do you have information about the printer(s) of this resource?
objectProperty.desc: This property points to one of the persons (an instance of Person) who has printed the item under analysis (PrimarySource)

objectProperty.name: hasTranslator
objectProperty.label: Do you have information about the translator(s) of this resource?
objectProperty.desc: This property points to one of the persons (an instance of Person) who has translated the item under analysis (PrimarySource)

objectProperty.name: assignsAuthorship
objectProperty.label: Does this resource assign a particular name as the author(s)?
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the person or persons (Person) that are mentioned as creators of the work

objectProperty.name: assignsAuthorship
objectProperty.label: Does this resource assign a particular name as the author(s) that do not exactly match the name of the author of the works?
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the name (Denomination) that is said to be the author (it might be a wrong attribution)

objectProperty.name: isCataloguedIn
objectProperty.label: Is this resource present in any catalogues?
objectProperty.desc: This property points to a catalogue (an instance of BibliographicSource) which references the item at hand

objectProperty.name: isCataloguedIn
objectProperty.label: Is this resource present in any catalogues?
objectProperty.desc: This property points to a catalogue (an instance of BibliographicSource) which references the item at hand

objectProperty.name: isEditedIn
objectProperty.label: Is this resource edited in any bibliographic items?
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the bibliographic item (BibliographicSource) that contains an edition of the current instance of WitnessCollection

objectProperty.name: isReferencedIn
objectProperty.label: Does this resource have specific bibliography?
objectProperty.desc: This property points to a bibliographic item (an instance of BibliographicSource) whose contents are related to the current item under analysis (usually, its specific bibliography)

objectProperty.name: isReproducedIn
objectProperty.label: Do you have information about the facsimile(s)?
objectProperty.desc: This property points to a Facsimile of the current instance of PrimarySource

objectProperty.name: wasOrderedBy
objectProperty.label: Do you have information about the person who ordered the creation of this resource?
objectProperty.desc: This property points to one of the persons (an instance of Person) who commaded the creation (copy or print) of the item at hand

objectProperty.name: wasOrderedBy
objectProperty.label: Do you have information about the entity (organisation or institution, etc) who ordered the creation of this resource?
objectProperty.desc: This property points to a institution/entity (an instance of Organisation) which commaded the creation of the item at hand

objectProperty.name: wasPreviouslyOwnedBy
objectProperty.label: Do you have information about previous owners of this resource (person)?
objectProperty.desc: This property points to one of the persons (an instance of Person) who owned at some points the item at hand

objectProperty.name: wasPreviouslyOwnedBy
objectProperty.label: Do you have information about previous owners of this resource (entity)?
objectProperty.desc: This property points to a institution/entity (an instance of Organisation) which owned at some point the item at hand

objectProperty.name: hasTheSameContent
objectProperty.desc: This property points to a bibliographic item (an instance of BibliographicSource) that has the same contents as the item at hand

objectProperty.name: hasMusicalNotation
objectProperty.desc: This property points to an instance of MusicalNotation which contents an edition of the musical content preserved in the current PrimarySource

dataProperty.name: title
dataProperty.label: Title
dataProperty.desc: An identifying name given to a text or tune

dataProperty.name: altTitle
dataProperty.label: Alternative title
dataProperty.desc: Alternative name, other known denominations of a text or tune

dataProperty.name: catalogueNumber
dataProperty.label: Catalogue number
dataProperty.desc: Alphanumeric string used to identify an item in a Repository

dataProperty.name: series
dataProperty.label: Series
dataProperty.desc: Name of reference for a set of successive volumes or issues of a periodical published in like form with similarity of subject or purpose

dataProperty.name: seriesNumber
dataProperty.label: Series number
dataProperty.desc: Number of the current item in a series set

dataProperty.name: numberOfVolumes
dataProperty.label: Number of volumes
dataProperty.desc: Total number of volumes

dataProperty.name: collectionName
dataProperty.label: Collection name
dataProperty.desc: Name of the repository collection in which the item is kept

dataProperty.name: collectionSponsor
dataProperty.label: Sponsor of the collection
dataProperty.desc: Name of the person or institution that provides monetary resources to the maintenance of the collection

dataProperty.name: copyright
dataProperty.label: Copyright
dataProperty.desc: Legal statement about the ownership of the item and its use

dataProperty.name: siglum
dataProperty.label: Siglum
dataProperty.desc: A letter or symbol which stands for a word or name, especially to denote a particular manuscript or edition of a text

dataProperty.name: category
dataProperty.label: Category
dataProperty.desc: Categorisation of the instance at hand

dataProperty.name: isPrint
dataProperty.label: Is it print?
dataProperty.desc: Whether the item is printed

dataProperty.name: repositoryUrl
dataProperty.label: URL to a repository
dataProperty.desc: URL to a repository entry related to the item at hand

dataProperty.name: pubPlace
dataProperty.label: Place of publication
dataProperty.desc: Place of publication of the bibliographic item

dataProperty.name: publisher
dataProperty.label: Publisher
dataProperty.desc: Publisher/publishing house of the bibliographic item

dataProperty.name: volumeNumber
dataProperty.label: Volume number
dataProperty.desc: Number of the volume

dataProperty.name: religiousAffiliation
dataProperty.label: Religious affiliation
dataProperty.desc: Association of a person or a text with a religion, denomination or sub–denominational religious group

dataProperty.name: isAutograph
dataProperty.label: is it an autograph?
dataProperty.desc: Whether the primary source is an autograph, that is, if it is transcribed entirely in the handwriting of its author

dataProperty.name: date
dataProperty.label: Date
dataProperty.desc: A particular point or period of time at which something happened or existed, or is expected to happen

dataProperty.name: firstEditionDate
dataProperty.label: Date of first edition
dataProperty.desc: Date of first edition

dataProperty.name: from
dataProperty.label: From (date range)
dataProperty.desc: Start date of a time-interval. In a closed-range interval it is used with to in order to define the range

dataProperty.name: to
dataProperty.label: To (date range)
dataProperty.desc: End date of a time-interval. In a closed-range interval it is used with from in order to define the range

dataProperty.name: notAfter
dataProperty.label: Not after (date)
dataProperty.desc: In uncertain dates, it specifies the latest possible date

dataProperty.name: notBefore
dataProperty.label: Not before (date)
dataProperty.desc: In uncertain dates, it specifies the earliest possible date

dataProperty.name: support
dataProperty.label: Support
dataProperty.desc: Type of material of the PrimarySource (e.g. parchment)

dataProperty.name: writingTechnique
dataProperty.label: Method used for writing
dataProperty.desc: Technique used for the implementation of writing (e.g. pigments, inscription, etc.)

dataProperty.name: dimensions
dataProperty.label: Dimensions
dataProperty.desc: Surface size, that is, dimensions of the page (in case the artifact is a book), of the stone, etc.

dataProperty.name: foliationType
dataProperty.label: Foliation type
dataProperty.desc: Unit of reference: folio or page
