dataProperty.name: function
dataProperty.label: Function
dataProperty.desc: Purpose of the PrimarySource (e.g. private or public)

dataProperty.name: numberOfFolios
dataProperty.label: Number of folios
dataProperty.desc: Number of folios

dataProperty.name: numberOfHands
dataProperty.label: Number of hands
dataProperty.desc: Number of scribes that participated in the copy

dataProperty.name: numberOfPages
dataProperty.label: Number of pages
dataProperty.desc: Number of pages the copy occupies

dataProperty.name: script
dataProperty.label: Script
dataProperty.desc: Style of the handwriting

dataProperty.name: hasDecoration
dataProperty.label: Is it decorated?
dataProperty.desc: Whether it is an illuminated manuscript or other type of artefact with illustrations

dataProperty.name: integrity
dataProperty.label: Integrity level
dataProperty.desc: Preservation status of text

dataProperty.name: isSongBookByAuthor
dataProperty.label: Is the songbook organised by author?
dataProperty.desc: Whether the PrimarySource, a song book, is organised by authors

dataProperty.name: numberOfWorks
dataProperty.label: Number of works
dataProperty.desc: Total number of works preserved in the PrimarySource

dataProperty.name: layout
dataProperty.label: Layout
dataProperty.desc: The arrangement of textual materials (images included) on a page

dataProperty.name: sourceType
dataProperty.label: Source type
dataProperty.desc: Documents if the record was created from de visu inspection or from a surrogate

dataProperty.name: toc
dataProperty.label: Table of contents
dataProperty.desc: Table of contents

dataProperty.name: editionCriteria
dataProperty.label: Edition criteria
dataProperty.desc: Edition criteria followed in the artefact used as source (for instance, the transcription criteria used in a folklore booksong)

dataProperty.name: hasMusicalNotation
dataProperty.label: Does it have musical notation?
dataProperty.desc: Whether the primary source contains musical notation

dataProperty.name: audio
dataProperty.label: Audio content
dataProperty.desc: Sound recording that reproduces the work when this recording is used as source

dataProperty.name: notes
dataProperty.label: Notes
dataProperty.desc: Comment or explanations

class.name: Punctuation
class.desc: Specific markings, signs and symbols that are used in and around sentences to give them structure and to allow for correct understanding and comprehension

objectProperty.name: isFirstToken
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the container (an instance of Line) of which the current item under analysis is its first token

objectProperty.name: nextToken
objectProperty.label: If you care about the order of the tokens in the line, do you want to define the next token (only if it is a punctuation sign)
objectProperty.desc: This property points to an instance of Punctuation that follows the current item under analysis

objectProperty.name: nextToken
objectProperty.label: If you care about the order of the tokens in the line, do you want to define the next token (only if it is a word)
objectProperty.desc: This property points to an instance of Word that follows the current item under analysis

objectProperty.name: previousToken
objectProperty.desc: This property points to an instance of Word that preceeds the current item under analysis

objectProperty.name: previousToken
objectProperty.desc: This property points to an instance of Punctuation that preceeds the current item under analysis

dataProperty.name: content
dataProperty.label: Content
dataProperty.desc: Full content of item

class.name: Redaction
class.desc: Representatives of a work, that is, of an Opus. Each version of a work is its own redaction. The palaeographic edition of A solis ortu usque ad occidua preserved in Lat. 1154 (BNF) and its critical edition are two Redaction of the same Opus

objectProperty.name: hasIllustration
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the image that acompanies the text

objectProperty.name: hasMusicalNotation
objectProperty.desc: This property points to an instance of MusicalNotation which contents a transcription of the melody of this Redaction

objectProperty.name: hasRelationsWith
objectProperty.label: Has this text any type of relations to other Works that can’t be described by the previous questions?
objectProperty.desc: This property points to a cultural product (Intertextuality) which has a generic intertextual relationship with the work under analysis

objectProperty.name: hasContemporaryRelation
objectProperty.label: Is this text related to other works from the same period?
objectProperty.desc: This property points to a cultural product (Intertextuality) which is contemporary to the work under analysis and some kind of intertextual relationship is detected

objectProperty.name: hasDerivedWork
objectProperty.label: Has this text influenced future Works?
objectProperty.desc: This property points to a cultural product (Intertextuality) which was based on the work under analysis

objectProperty.name: usesAsSource
objectProperty.label: Is this work derived from a previous Work?
objectProperty.desc: This property points to a cultural product (Intertextuality) which was a source for the work under analysis

objectProperty.name: UsedForSynthesis
objectProperty.desc: This property points to another text (an instance of Redaction) which is a synthesis of the version at hand (the current Redaction)

objectProperty.name: considers
objectProperty.label: Does this text consider the versions of different witnesses
objectProperty.desc: This property points to one of the witnesses (an instance of Witness) used for the edition at hand (the current Redaction)

objectProperty.name: interprets
objectProperty.label: The current version of the work that you are analysing is a palaeographic/diplomatic edition?
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the Witness of which the current text is a documentary edition

objectProperty.name: hasCharacter
objectProperty.label: Do you want to provide information about the characters/roles?
objectProperty.desc: This property points to an instance of Role which contains analytical information about one of the characters depicted in the text under analysis

objectProperty.name: hasEditor
objectProperty.label: Do you know what person(s) edited this text?
objectProperty.desc: This property points to one of the persons (an instance of Person) who has edited the item at hand

objectProperty.name: hasItem
objectProperty.label: Does this text have an acrostic?
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the Acrostic contained in the current instance of the Redaction

objectProperty.name: hasItem
objectProperty.label: Does this text have marginalia or other type of annotations?
objectProperty.desc: This property points to an instance of paratextual information (Paratext) that concerns the Redaction at hand

objectProperty.name: hasMusic
objectProperty.label: Was this text sung and do you have information regarding its melody?
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the instance of Melody that provides the musical contents of the text under analysis (Redaction)

objectProperty.name: hasFirstLine
objectProperty.label: Do you want to analyse this text by line? If so, point to the first line
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the first line (an instance of Line) which form the current element under analysis

objectProperty.name: hasFirstPart
objectProperty.label: Is this text divided in other smaller units such as sections or chapters? If so, point to the first part
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the first text unit (an instance of Redaction) which form the current element under analysis

objectProperty.name: isFirstPart
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the container (an instance of Redaction) of which the item at hand is its first part

objectProperty.name: hasFirstPart
objectProperty.label: Is this text divided in other smaller units such pieces of prose and verse? If so, point to the first verse part
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the first verse unit (an instance of Stanza) which form the current element under analysis (specially meant for works that combine both prose and verse)

objectProperty.name: nextPart
objectProperty.label: Is this text divided in other smaller units such as sections or chapters? If so, point to the next part
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the next text unit (an instance of Redaction) which, together with the current item, form the same textual unit

objectProperty.name: previousPart
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the previous text unit (an instance of Redaction) which, together with the current item, form the same textual unit

objectProperty.name: hasFirstStanza
objectProperty.label: Do you want to analyse this text by stanza/group of lines? If so, point to the first stanza
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the first group of lines (an instance of Stanza) which form the current element under analysis

objectProperty.name: hasPart
objectProperty.desc: This property points to a part of the Redaction, that is, an instance of Stanza when the ordering of those parts is not relevant. E.g. when the only requirement is to define the refrain or the tornada but now the whole text

objectProperty.name: hasSpeaker
objectProperty.label: Do you want to provide information about the speaking roles?
objectProperty.desc: This property points to one of the speakers (and instance of Role) depicted in the text

objectProperty.name: isTranslated
objectProperty.desc: This property points to another version (an instance of Redaction) which is a translation of the current item being analysed

objectProperty.name: isTranslation
objectProperty.desc: This property points to another work (an instance of Redaction) from which the current item being analysed was translated

objectProperty.name: isAnalysedThrough
objectProperty.label: Do you want to provide apparatus notation (using as reference the whole text, not smaller units of text)?
objectProperty.desc: This property points to an item (Apparatus) that contains analytical content about the current instance of Redaction

objectProperty.name: isAnalysedThrough
objectProperty.label: Do you want to provide prosodic information at line level?
objectProperty.desc: This property points to an item (LinePattern) that contains analytical content about the current instance of Redaction

objectProperty.name: isAnalysedThrough
objectProperty.label: Do you want to provide prosodic information at stanza level?
objectProperty.desc: This property points to an item (StanzaPattern) that contains analytical content about the current instance of Redaction

objectProperty.name: isAnalysedThrough
objectProperty.label: Do you want to provide prosodic information at work level?
objectProperty.desc: This property points to an item (WorkPattern) that contains analytical content about the current instance of Redaction

objectProperty.name: isCollatedBy
objectProperty.label: Do you want to provide information about the person who has collated the witnesses?
objectProperty.desc: This peroperty points to one of the persons (an instance of Person) who has collated the text at hand

objectProperty.name: isDedicatedTo
objectProperty.label: Does this work have a dedicatee(s)?
objectProperty.desc: This peroperty points to one of the persons (an instance of Person) to whom the current text was dedicated

objectProperty.name: isEditedIn
objectProperty.label: Do you want to add information about different editions of this text?
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the bibliographic item (BibliographicSource) that contains an edition of the current instance of Redaction

objectProperty.name: hasPreviousEdition
objectProperty.desc: This property points to a bibliographic item (BibliographicSource) which contains a previous edition of the work

objectProperty.name: isEditedIn
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the specif part of a bibliographic item (Location) where an edition of the current instance of Redaction is located

objectProperty.name: isIndexedIn
objectProperty.label: Is this text indexed somewhere?
objectProperty.desc: This property points to a bibliographic item (an instance of BibliographicSource) in which the current text is indexed

objectProperty.name: isOrganisedIn
objectProperty.label: Do you want to divide the text by scenes?
objectProperty.desc: This property points to one of the scenes (an instance of Scene) in which the current text can be divided

objectProperty.name: isPart
objectProperty.label: Does this text belong to a collection of works?
objectProperty.desc: This propery points to the instance of Ensemble to which the Redaction at hand belongs

objectProperty.name: isReferencedIn
objectProperty.label: Has this text specific bibliography?
objectProperty.desc: This property points to a bibliographic item (an instance of BibliographicSource) whose contents are related to the current item under analysis (usually, its specific bibliography)

objectProperty.name: isReferencedIn
objectProperty.desc: This property points to a particular section of a bibliographic item (an instance of Location) whose contents are related to the current item under analysis (usually, the specific location of a bibliographic reference)

objectProperty.name: isSynthesis
objectProperty.label: Is this edition the synthesis of several versions of a text?
objectProperty.desc: This property points to one of the texts (an instance of Redaction) which is an analytical version of the text at hand (the current Redaction)

objectProperty.name: hasTranslation
objectProperty.label: Do you want to provide references to any translations of the text?
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the bibliographic item (an instance of BibliographicSource) which contains a translation of the text at hand

objectProperty.name: mentions
objectProperty.label: Does this text mention any places?
objectProperty.desc: This property points to an instance of Place that is referred in the current under analysis

objectProperty.name: mentions
objectProperty.label: Does this text mention any persons?
objectProperty.desc: This property points to an instance of Person that is referred in the current under analysis

objectProperty.name: mentions
objectProperty.label: Does this text mention any events?
objectProperty.desc: This property points to an instance of Event that is referred in the current under analysis

objectProperty.name: mentions
objectProperty.label: Does this text mention any organisations?
objectProperty.desc: This property points to an instance of Organisation that is referred in the current under analysis

objectProperty.name: presents
objectProperty.label: Do you want to analyse the different figures of speech (using as reference the whole text, not smaller units of text)?
objectProperty.desc: This propery points to an instance of FigureOfSpeech that is contained in the current item under analysis

objectProperty.name: presents
objectProperty.label: Do you want to add information regarding rhyme (using as reference the whole text, not smaller units of text)?
objectProperty.desc: This propery points to an instance of Rhyme that is contained in the current item under analysis

objectProperty.name: realises
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the work (an instance of Opus) of which the text at hand (the current Redaction) is a materialisation

objectProperty.name: retrievesText
objectProperty.label: Do you want to say from which edition the electronic text was taken?
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the bibliographic item (an instance of BibliographicSource) which contains the edition used as the base of text at hand

objectProperty.name: retrievesText
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the specific section of a bibliographic item (an instance of Location) which contains the edition used as the base of text at hand

objectProperty.name: isUsedIn
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the song/act (an instance of Performance) that uses the text under analysis (an instance of Redaction)

dataProperty.name: title
dataProperty.label: Title
dataProperty.desc: An identifying name given to a text or tune

dataProperty.name: subtitle
dataProperty.label: Subtitle
dataProperty.desc: A secondary, usually explanatory title

dataProperty.name: originalTitle
dataProperty.label: Original title
dataProperty.desc: The identifying name of a text or tune as it appears in its PrimarySource

dataProperty.name: altTitle
dataProperty.label: Alternative title
dataProperty.desc: Alternative name, other known denominations of a text or tune

dataProperty.name: text
dataProperty.label: Unstructured textual content
dataProperty.desc: Textual contents in an unstructured manner. The contents of this property do not allow finer analysis by stanza or line. It can be a text of a diplomatic edition, semidiplomatic edition or of a critical edition (among others) or even a translation. The property typeOfRedaction defines the type of Edition or if it is a translation

dataProperty.name: typeOfRedaction
dataProperty.label: Type of text provided (type of edition)
dataProperty.desc: The type of the text provided in the Redaction Diplomatic edition, critical edition, translation

dataProperty.name: sampleText
dataProperty.label: Sample text
dataProperty.desc: Excerpt

dataProperty.name: firstLines
dataProperty.label: First lines
dataProperty.desc: Initial verses of the composition

dataProperty.name: lastLines
dataProperty.label: Last lines
dataProperty.desc: Final verses of the composition

dataProperty.name: audience
dataProperty.label: Audience
dataProperty.desc: The meant readership, viewers or listeners of a cultural product

dataProperty.name: commentary
dataProperty.label: Commentary
dataProperty.desc: An explanatory series of notes or comments; an explanatory essay or treatise on a text

dataProperty.name: textualUnit
dataProperty.label: The type of textual element (e.g. epilogue, prologue, text composed of individual stanzas)
dataProperty.desc: The type of textual element (e.g. part of a greater ensemble; part of a composed collection of poems; prologue of a work; epilogue of a work; a chapter of a work...)

dataProperty.name: date
dataProperty.label: Date
dataProperty.desc: A particular point or period of time at which something happened or existed, or is expected to happen

dataProperty.name: from
dataProperty.label: From (date range)
dataProperty.desc: Start date of a time-interval. In a closed-range interval it is used with to in order to define the range

dataProperty.name: notAfter
dataProperty.label: Not after (date)
dataProperty.desc: In uncertain dates, it specifies the latest possible date

dataProperty.name: notBefore
dataProperty.label: Not before (date)
dataProperty.desc: In uncertain dates, it specifies the earliest possible date

dataProperty.name: to
dataProperty.label: To (date range)
dataProperty.desc: End date of a time-interval. In a closed-range interval it is used with from in order to define the range

dataProperty.name: dateCertainty
dataProperty.label: Date certainty
dataProperty.desc: Level of certainty regarding a stated date

dataProperty.name: dateNote
dataProperty.label: Notes about the datation
dataProperty.desc: Comments in relation to a stated date

dataProperty.name: incipit
dataProperty.label: Incipit
dataProperty.desc: The first line of the work

dataProperty.name: explicit
dataProperty.label: Explicit
dataProperty.desc: The closing words of the composition (usually, the last verse)

dataProperty.name: function
dataProperty.label: Function
dataProperty.desc: Purpose of the text

dataProperty.name: genre
dataProperty.label: Genre
dataProperty.desc: Type of art, literature or music characterized by a specific form, content and style

dataProperty.name: isSung
dataProperty.label: Is it sung?
dataProperty.desc: Whether the Redaction was composed to be sung

dataProperty.name: keyword
dataProperty.label: Keyword
dataProperty.desc: A significant or descriptive word. Usually, a word used as a reference point for finding other words or information

dataProperty.name: language
dataProperty.label: Language
dataProperty.desc: Language of the text

dataProperty.name: layout
dataProperty.label: Layout
dataProperty.desc: The arrangement of textual materials (images included) on a page

dataProperty.name: lengthUnit
dataProperty.label: Length unit
dataProperty.desc: Names the unit used for the measurement

dataProperty.name: lengthQuantity
dataProperty.label: Length quantity
dataProperty.desc: Specifies the length in the unit selected in the property lengthUnit

dataProperty.name: paraphrasis
dataProperty.label: Paraphrasis
dataProperty.desc: The recasting of the contents in words different from that originally used, whether in the same language or in a translation

dataProperty.name: notes
dataProperty.label: Notes
dataProperty.desc: Comment or explanations

dataProperty.name: numberOfWitnessesUsed
dataProperty.label: Number of witnesses used for edition
dataProperty.desc: Number of PrimarySources used in the elaboration of an edition

dataProperty.name: witnessesNotUsed
dataProperty.label: Witnesses not used
dataProperty.desc: Primary sources of the text excluded during the elaboration of an edition (usually, dependent witnesses)

dataProperty.name: originalLanguage
dataProperty.label: Original language
dataProperty.desc: The language from which the Redaction/Opus is a translation

dataProperty.name: setting
dataProperty.label: Setting
dataProperty.desc: Location of the narrative

dataProperty.name: additionalFile
dataProperty.label: Additional file
dataProperty.desc: A file (XML, PFD, plain text) which contains the Redaction and, likely, other type of analytical information

class.name: Repository
class.desc: A building or room containing collections of books, periodicals, and sometimes films and recorded music

objectProperty.name: hasItem
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the bibliographic item (an instance of BibliographicSource) which is kept in the Repository at hand

objectProperty.name: hasItem
objectProperty.desc: This property points to an artifact (an instance of PrimarySource) which is kept in the Repository at hand

objectProperty.name: isLocatedIn
objectProperty.label: Where is this repository/library?
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the Place where the current Repository is located

objectProperty.name: provides
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the instance of Facsimile that are accessed from the current Repository

dataProperty.name: name
dataProperty.label: Name
dataProperty.desc: Contains a proper noun or noun phrase that refers the current item

class.name: Rhyme
class.desc: Repetition of similar sounding words occurring at the end of lines in poems or songs

objectProperty.name: isPresentIn
objectProperty.desc: This property points to one of the lines (instance of Line) which contains the current item under analysis

objectProperty.name: isPresentIn
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the text (instance of Redaction) which contains the current item under analysis

objectProperty.name: isPresentIn
objectProperty.desc: This property points to one of the line grouping (instance of Stanza) which contains the current item under analysis

objectProperty.name: matches
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the instance of RhymeMatch that contains the echo of the current rhyme word under analysis

objectProperty.name: hasRhymeWord
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the instance of Word for a further linguistic analysis/division by words

dataProperty.name: category
dataProperty.label: Category
dataProperty.desc: Categorisation of the item at hand

dataProperty.name: ending
dataProperty.label: Ending
dataProperty.desc: Contents from the last stressed vowel of the rhyme to its end

dataProperty.name: prefinalConsonants
dataProperty.label: Prefinal consonants
dataProperty.desc: Consonants between the stressed vowel and the last consonant

dataProperty.name: finalConsonant
dataProperty.label: Final consonant
dataProperty.desc: Last consonant of rhyming word

dataProperty.name: isEcho
dataProperty.label: Is it a rhyming echo?
dataProperty.desc: Whether the word in a rhyming pair under analysis is the first one (false) or the second (true)

dataProperty.name: label
dataProperty.label: Label (usually, “a”, “b”, “c”, etc.)
dataProperty.desc: String used to identify the item at hand

dataProperty.name: lineNumber
dataProperty.label: Line number
dataProperty.desc: Number of the verse

dataProperty.name: clausula
dataProperty.label: Clausula/Rhyme gender
dataProperty.desc: The rhythmic ending of a line determined by the number of unstressed syllables following the last stressed one. This property is both valid for accentual and syllabic versification, so possible values include: masculine (zero syllables), femenine (one), dactylic, proparoxitone, etc.

dataProperty.name: rhymeGrapheme
dataProperty.label: Rhyme grapheme
dataProperty.desc: Grapheme that represents the rhyming sounds

dataProperty.name: rhymePhoneme
dataProperty.label: Rhyme phoneme
dataProperty.desc: Phonetic transcription of the rhyming sounds

dataProperty.name: rhymePosition
dataProperty.label: Rhyme position
dataProperty.desc: REVIEW: Position of the rhyme in the line

dataProperty.name: rhymeVowelPosition
dataProperty.label: Rhyme vowel position
dataProperty.desc: REVIEW: Position of the stressed vowel of the rhyme word

dataProperty.name: rhymeWord
dataProperty.label: Rhyme word
dataProperty.desc: Word that rhymes with another word

class.name: RhymeMatch
class.desc: Entity to define the correspondences between rhyming words

objectProperty.name: corresponds
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the instance of Rhyme whose rhyming word is described by the current instance of RhymeMatch

objectProperty.name: lineOfCall
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the instance of Line that contains a rhyme word which is the call (first element of a rhyming pair) of the rhyme under analysis

objectProperty.name: lineOfEcho
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the instance of Line that contains a rhyme word which is the echo (the second element of a rhyming pair) of the the rhyme under analysis

objectProperty.name: hasRhymeWord
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the instance of Word for a further linguistic analysis/division by words

dataProperty.name: rhymeWordMatch
dataProperty.label: Rhyming word (match)
dataProperty.desc: Word that rhymes with the current rhyming word under analysis. In case the analysis is being done by word, use instead the object property Word -- isRhymeWord -- RhymeMatch

dataProperty.name: typeOfRhymeMatching
dataProperty.label: Type of rhyme matching (e.g. perfect/imperfect or assonant/consonant)
dataProperty.desc: Explain the degree in which the different rhyming sounds match (e.g. assonant, consonant, perfect, imperfect, half-rhyme...)

class.name: Role
class.desc: Function of a person or character

objectProperty.name: isCharacter
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the text (instance of Redaction) which depicts the Role at hand

objectProperty.name: isAssignedTo
objectProperty.label: To whom belongs this role?
objectProperty.desc: This property points to one of the persons (instance of Person) to whom the current Role belongs

objectProperty.name: isCharacter
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the work (instance of Opus) which depicts the Role at hand

objectProperty.name: speaks
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the text (instance of Redaction) in which the current Role is one of its speakers

objectProperty.name: hasPerformer
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the Person who performs the role

objectProperty.name: isReferenced
objectProperty.desc: This property points to an instance of Event in which the current item under analysis is referenced

objectProperty.name: isReferenced
objectProperty.desc: This property points to an instance of Paratext in which the current item under analysis is referenced

dataProperty.name: date
dataProperty.label: Date
dataProperty.desc: A particular point or period of time at which something happened or existed, or is expected to happen

dataProperty.name: description
dataProperty.label: Description of the role
dataProperty.desc: A statement or an account characterising the role under analysis

dataProperty.name: from
dataProperty.label: From (date range)
dataProperty.desc: Start date of a time-interval. In a closed-range interval it is used with to in order to define the range

dataProperty.name: to
dataProperty.label: To (date range)
dataProperty.desc: End date of a time-interval. In a closed-range interval it is used with from in order to define the range

dataProperty.name: notAfter
dataProperty.label: Not after (date)
dataProperty.desc: In uncertain dates, it specifies the latest possible date

dataProperty.name: notBefore
dataProperty.label: Not before (date)
dataProperty.desc: In uncertain dates, it specifies the earliest possible date

objectProperty.name: isCharacter
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the act/song (instance of Performance) which depicts the Role at hand

dataProperty.name: role
dataProperty.label: Role
dataProperty.desc: Function of a person or character. In a play, it is the character or part played by a performer

dataProperty.name: typeOfCharacter
dataProperty.label: Type of character
dataProperty.desc: Type of character (eg. “main”, “antagonist”, etc.)

class.name: Scene
class.desc: A division of the narrative. A poem can be divided in different scenes

objectProperty.name: nextScene
objectProperty.label: In case you have more than one scene, do you want provide information about the next scene?
objectProperty.desc: This property points to an instance of Scene that follows the current item under analysis

objectProperty.name: previousScene
objectProperty.desc: This property points to an instance of Scene that preceeds the current item under analysis

objectProperty.name: organises
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the text (instance of Redaction) of which the current Scene is a division

objectProperty.name: isIllustrated
objectProperty.desc: This property points to a Illustration related to the current Scene

dataProperty.name: summary
dataProperty.label: Summary
dataProperty.desc: Abstract, synopsis, brief outline

class.name: Stanza
class.desc:
Group of lines. Usually, this grouping forms the basic recurring metrical unit of a poem, song or play As armas e os barões assinalados,
Que da ocidental praia Lusitana,
Por mares nunca de antes navegados,
Passaram ainda além da Taprobana,
Em perigos e guerras esforçados,
Mais do que prometia a força humana,
E entre gente remota edificaram
Novo Reino, que tanto sublimaram;

objectProperty.name: isTranslated
objectProperty.desc: This property points to another stanza (an instance of Stanza) which is a translation of the current item being analysed

objectProperty.name: isTranslation
objectProperty.desc: This property points to another stanza (an instance of Stanza) from which the current item being analysed was translated

objectProperty.name: hasCreator
objectProperty.label: Who composed this stanza?
objectProperty.desc: This property points to one of the persons (an instance of Person) who has created the Stanza under analysis

objectProperty.name: hasEditor
objectProperty.label: Has a specific scholar edited this stanza?
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the Person who has edited the current instance of the Stanza

objectProperty.name: hasMusicalNotation
objectProperty.desc: This property points to an instance of MusicalNotation which contents a transcription of the melody of this Stanza

objectProperty.name: hasFirstLine
objectProperty.label: Do you want to describe the different lines that form this stanza? If so, point to the first line
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the first line (an instance of Line) which form the current element under analysis

objectProperty.name: isFirstStanza
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the text (an instance of Redaction) of which the current item under analysis is its first line grouping

objectProperty.name: isFirstPart
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the container (an instance of Redaction) of which the item at hand is its first part

objectProperty.name: isPart
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the Redaction of which the item at hand is a part

objectProperty.name: hasFirstPart
objectProperty.label: Do you want to divide this stanza in a smaller unit? If so, point to the first group of lines
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the first group of lines (an instance of Stanza) which form the current element under analysis

objectProperty.name: nextPart
objectProperty.label: Do you want to divide this stanza in a smaller unit? If so, point to the next group of lines
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the next group of lines (an instance of Stanza) which form the current element under analysis

objectProperty.name: nextStanza
objectProperty.desc: This property points to an instance of Stanza that follows the current item under analysis

objectProperty.name: isFirstPart
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the container element (an instance of Stanza) of which the current element under analysis is its first part

objectProperty.name: previousPart
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the previous group of lines (an instance of Stanza) which, together with the current element under analysis, is part of the same textual unit

objectProperty.name: previousStanza
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the previous group of lines (an instance of Stanza) which, together with the current element under analysis, is part of the same textual unit

objectProperty.name: isAnalysedThrough
objectProperty.label: Do you want to introduce prosodic information at the stanza level?
objectProperty.desc: This property points to an item (StanzaPattern) that contains analytical content about the current instance of Stanza

objectProperty.name: isEditedIn
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the specific part of a bibliographic item (Location) where an edition of the current instance of Stanza is located

objectProperty.name: isReferencedIn
objectProperty.desc: This property points to a particular section of a bibliographic item (an instance of Location) whose contents are related to the current item under analysis (usually, the specific location of a bibliographic reference)

objectProperty.name: considers
objectProperty.label: Does this text consider the versions of different witnesses
objectProperty.desc: This property points to one of the witnesses (an instance of Witness) used for the edition at hand (the current Stanza)

objectProperty.name: interprets
objectProperty.label: The current version of the work that you are analysing is a palaeographic/diplomatic edition?
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the Witness of which the current text is a documentary edition

objectProperty.name: isTheSameAs
objectProperty.desc: This property points to another instance of Stanza which belongs to another work or ensemble but that has the same contents as the current item at hand

objectProperty.name: presents
objectProperty.label: Do you want to provide information about rhyme?
objectProperty.desc: This propery points to an instance of Rhyme that is contained in the current item under analysis

dataProperty.name: incipit
dataProperty.label: Incipit
dataProperty.desc: The first line of the work

dataProperty.name: isNotMetricStanza
dataProperty.label: Is it not a metric stanza?
dataProperty.desc: If Stanza is a metrical unit, then this should be “no”. Otherwise (e.g. a section, a lai, etc.) it should be set to “yes”

dataProperty.name: isRefrainOmitted
dataProperty.label: Has the refrain been omitted?
dataProperty.desc: Whether the copy of the refrain was omitted

dataProperty.name: typeOfStanza
dataProperty.label: Type of stanza (not metrical categorisation)
dataProperty.desc: Type of stanza, but not in relation to its metrics. E.g. tornada, refrain

dataProperty.name: language
dataProperty.label: Language
dataProperty.desc: Language of the text

dataProperty.name: stanzaNumber
dataProperty.label: Stanza number
dataProperty.desc: Position of the stanza inside the composition

dataProperty.name: altStanzaNumber
dataProperty.label: Alternative stanza number
dataProperty.desc: Position of the stanza inside the composition when a different ordering is possible

dataProperty.name: editionNotes
dataProperty.label: Edition notes
dataProperty.desc: Editorial commentary

dataProperty.name: paraphrasis
dataProperty.label: Paraphrasis
dataProperty.desc: The recasting of the contents in words different from that originally used, whether in the same language or in a translation

dataProperty.name: typeOfStanzaEdition
dataProperty.label: Type of text provided (type of edition)
dataProperty.desc: The type of the text provided in the Stanza Diplomatic edition, critical edition, translation

class.name: StanzaPattern
class.desc: The prosodic analysis using a Stanza as the unit of reference The number of lines of a Stanza or its categorisation according to metrics (such as “quatrain”)

objectProperty.name: analyses
objectProperty.desc: This propery points to an instance of Redaction about which the item at hand presents analytical information

objectProperty.name: analyses
objectProperty.desc: This propery points to an instance of Stanza about which the item at hand presents analytical information

objectProperty.name: uses
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the instance of MetricalEncoding in which the conventions implemented in the item at hand are explained

objectProperty.name: isReferencedIn
objectProperty.label: Is this analysis (or part of this analysis) referenced in a specific bibliography (e.g repertoire, catalogue, etc)
objectProperty.desc: This property points to a bibliographic item (an instance of BibliographicSource) whose contents are related to the current item under analysis (usually, its specific bibliography)

dataProperty.name: numberOfLines
dataProperty.label: Number of lines
dataProperty.desc: Number of lines in item

dataProperty.name: metricalType
dataProperty.label: Metrical type
dataProperty.desc: Categorisation of the stanza/line grouping according to metrics. E.g. “sapphic stanza”

dataProperty.name: accentualMetricalScheme
dataProperty.label: Accentual metrical scheme
dataProperty.desc: Metrical scheme for accentual or accentual-syllabic metre

dataProperty.name: feetType
dataProperty.label: Feet type
dataProperty.desc: Categorisation of the stanza according to the type of feet

dataProperty.name: footType
dataProperty.label: Foot type
dataProperty.desc: Type of foot (e.g. iamb). To be used only in cases that a more detailed analysis is not done (see Foot)

dataProperty.name: syllabicMetricalScheme
dataProperty.label: Syllabic metrical scheme
dataProperty.desc: Metrical scheme according to the number of syllables

dataProperty.name: altSyllabicMetricalScheme
dataProperty.label: Alternative syllabic metrical scheme
dataProperty.desc: Alternative metrical schema (e.g. long lines with caesura opposite to short lines)

dataProperty.name: rhythmicalNotation
dataProperty.label: Rhythmical notation
dataProperty.desc: Notation based on the distribution of weak and strong positions for rhythmical purposes. Specially meant for non-accentual/quantitative versification

dataProperty.name: rhymeScheme
dataProperty.label: Rhyme scheme
dataProperty.desc: A rhyme scheme is the pattern of rhymes at the end of each line of a poem or song. It is usually referred to by using letters to indicate which lines rhyme; lines designated with the same letter all rhyme with each other

dataProperty.name: altRhymeScheme
dataProperty.label: Alternative rhyme scheme
dataProperty.desc: An alternative rhyme scheme (usually in relation with an alternative metrical scheme)

dataProperty.name: clausula
dataProperty.label: Clausula/Rhyme gender
dataProperty.desc: The categorisation of the stanza according to the rhythmic ending of a line determined by the number of unstressed syllables following the last stressed one. This property is both valid for accentual and syllabic versification, so possible values include: masculine (zero syllables), femenine (one), dactylic, proparoxitone, etc.

dataProperty.name: clausulaScheme
dataProperty.label: Clausula scheme/Gonique scheme
dataProperty.desc: Pattern of clausulae, that is, the ending of a line determined by the number of unstressed syllables following the last stressed one.

dataProperty.name: clausulaSchemeType
dataProperty.label: Type of stanza according to clausulae/rhyme gender
dataProperty.desc: Categorisation of the stanza according to the distribution of clausulae/gender of rhymes (eg. “classic”, “heterogonique”, etc.)

dataProperty.name: hasCaesura
dataProperty.label: Does it contain caesurae?
dataProperty.desc: Whether it contains any lines with a pause/break near its middle

dataProperty.name: typeOfRhymeMatching
dataProperty.label: Type of rhyme matching (e.g. assonant or consonant)
dataProperty.desc: Categorisation of the stanza according to the degree in which the different rhyming sounds match (e.g. assonant, consonant...)

dataProperty.name: rhymeDispositionType
dataProperty.label: Rhyme disposition (categorisation)
dataProperty.desc: Categorisation of the stanza according to the diposition of the rhymes (eg. “cross”, “pair”)

dataProperty.name: metricalNotes
dataProperty.label: Metrical notes
dataProperty.desc: Metrical commentary

dataProperty.name: rhymeNotes
dataProperty.label: Rhyme notes
dataProperty.desc: Commentary on rhyming features

class.name: Syllable
class.desc: A linguistic analysis using the syllable as the unit of reference. E.g. the onset and coda of the rhyme vowel. Both prosodic and linguistic

objectProperty.name: isFirstSyllable
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the word (an instance of Word) of which the item at hand is its first syllable

objectProperty.name: nextSyllable
objectProperty.label: If you want to introduce more syllables, please introduce information about the next one
objectProperty.desc: This property points to an instance of Syllable in order to analyse the syllable that comes after the syllable at hand

objectProperty.name: isFirstSyllable
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the word (an instance of Line) of which the item at hand is its first syllable

objectProperty.name: previousSyllable
objectProperty.desc: This property points to an instance of Syllable in order to analyse the syllable that comes before the syllable at hand

objectProperty.name: synalephaSecondElement
objectProperty.desc: This propety points to the next linguistic syllable that is merged with the current instance of Syllable from a prosodic point of view (synalepha)

objectProperty.name: synalephaFirstElement
objectProperty.desc: This propety points to the previous linguistic syllable that is merged with the current instance of Syllable from a prosodic point of view (synalepha)

objectProperty.name: previousSyllableDialepha
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the previous Syllable if there is a dialepha between both instances

objectProperty.name: nextSyllableDialepha
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the next Syllable if there is a dialepha between both instances

dataProperty.name: content
dataProperty.label: Content
dataProperty.desc: Full content of item

dataProperty.name: nucleusType
dataProperty.label: Type of syllabic nucleus
dataProperty.desc: Type of syllabic nucleus (linguistic typology)

dataProperty.name: onset
dataProperty.label: Onset
dataProperty.desc: Sound or sounds occurring before the nucleus, a consonant or consonant cluster

dataProperty.name: coda
dataProperty.label: Coda
dataProperty.desc: Sound or sounds that follow the nucleus

dataProperty.name: weight
dataProperty.label: Syllable weight
dataProperty.desc: Pattern according to the number and/or duration of segments in the syllabic rime, that is, the nucleus and coda

dataProperty.name: positionInWord
dataProperty.label: Position in the word
dataProperty.desc: Position of the syllable in the word 3/4 (= third syllable in a four-syllable word)

dataProperty.name: isStressed
dataProperty.label: Is it stressed?
dataProperty.desc: Whether the syllable is stressed

dataProperty.name: hasSynizesis
dataProperty.label: Does it have any synizeses?
dataProperty.desc: It presents the union in pronunciation of two adjacent vowels/syllables into one syllable

dataProperty.name: hasSynalepha
dataProperty.label: Does this syllable contain a synalepha?
dataProperty.desc: Wether this prosodic syllable responds to a synalepha

dataProperty.name: hasHiatus
dataProperty.label: Does it have a hiatus?
dataProperty.desc: It contains the separate pronunciation of the two vowels in a diphthong for the sake of meter

class.name: Witness
class.desc: A text or ensembles of texts preserved in a PrimarySource. Following with the example given in the description of PrimarySource, that song by Martim Codax has three witnesses

objectProperty.name: hasCollector
objectProperty.label: Can you provide information about the person(s) who collected the textual materials of this witness?
objectProperty.desc: This property points to one of the persons (an instance of Person) who has collected the materials of the current intance of Witness

objectProperty.name: assignsAuthorship
objectProperty.label: Does the witness specify the authorship in a way that requires further analysis (wrong attribution, alternative names, etc.)
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the name (Denomination) that is said to be the author (it might be a wrong attribution)

objectProperty.name: hasReading
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the Apparatus entry which contains a reading from this instance of Witness

objectProperty.name: hasReading
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the Apparatus entry which contains a reading from this instance of Witness

objectProperty.name: comesFrom
objectProperty.label: Do you know the origin of the witness (geographical place)?
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the Place which is the provenance of the current instance of Witness

objectProperty.name: hasCopyist
objectProperty.label: Do you have information about the copyist(s)?
objectProperty.desc: This property points to one of the persons (an instance of Person) who has participated in the copy of the current intance of Witness

objectProperty.name: hasInformant
objectProperty.label: Do you have information about the informant(s)?
objectProperty.desc: This property points to one of the persons (an instance of Person) who has participated as an informant for the materials of the current intance of Witness

objectProperty.name: hasItem
objectProperty.label: Does the witness contain any paratextual information?
objectProperty.desc: This property points to an instance of paratextual information (Paratext) contained by the Witness at hand

objectProperty.name: hasItem
objectProperty.label: Does the witness have any miniatures?
objectProperty.desc: This property points to one of the miniatures (an instance of Illustration) contained by the Witness at hand

objectProperty.name: isConsideredBy
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the text (an instance of Redaction) that used the current item as one of its witnesses

objectProperty.name: isInterpretedBy
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the text (an instance of Redaction) which is a documentary edition of the item at hand

objectProperty.name: isConsideredBy
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the stanza/group of lines (an instance of Stanza) that used the current item as one of its witnesses

objectProperty.name: isInterpretedBy
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the stanza/group of lines (an instance of Stanza) which is a documentary edition of the item at hand

objectProperty.name: isEditedIn
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the specific part of a bibliographic item (Location) where an edition of the current instance of Witness is located

objectProperty.name: isEditedIn
objectProperty.label: Is this witness edited in a bibliographic item?
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the bibliographic item (BibliographicSource) that contains an edition of the current instance of Witness

objectProperty.name: isPart
objectProperty.label: Do you have information about the Manuscript/Source the witness is part of?
objectProperty.desc: This propery points to the instance of PrimarySource to which the Witness at hand belongs

objectProperty.name: isReproducedIn
objectProperty.label: Do you have information about the facsimile?
objectProperty.desc: This property points to a Facsimile of the current instance of Witness

objectProperty.name: isPart
objectProperty.label: Is this witness part of a particular ensemble/section of the manuscript/source?
objectProperty.desc: This propery points to the instance of WitnessCollection to which the Witness at hand belongs

objectProperty.name: nextWitnessInCollection
objectProperty.label: If this witness is part of a particular ensemble/section do you care about the order? If so please select the next witness in the collection.
objectProperty.desc: This property points to an instance of Witness which follows the current item under analysis

objectProperty.name: previousWitnessInCollection
objectProperty.desc: This property points to an instance of Witness which preceeds the current item under analysis

objectProperty.name: hasMusicalNotation
objectProperty.desc: This property points to an instance of MusicalNotation which contents an edition of the musical content preserved in the current Witness

dataProperty.name: incipit
dataProperty.label: Incipit
dataProperty.desc: The first line of the work

dataProperty.name: explicit
dataProperty.label: Explicit
dataProperty.desc: The closing words of the composition (usually, the last verse)

dataProperty.name: firstLines
dataProperty.label: First lines
dataProperty.desc: Initial verses of the composition

dataProperty.name: lastLines
dataProperty.label: Last lines
dataProperty.desc: Final verses of the composition

dataProperty.name: title
dataProperty.label: Title
dataProperty.desc: An identifying name given to a text or tune

dataProperty.name: siglum
dataProperty.label: Siglum
dataProperty.desc: A letter or symbol which stands for a word or name, especially to denote a particular manuscript or edition of a text

dataProperty.name: workNumber
dataProperty.label: Work number
dataProperty.desc: Number of the work in the PrimarySource or edition

dataProperty.name: context
dataProperty.label: Context (e.g. surrounding texts)
dataProperty.desc: Information about the texts surrounding the witness of the poem in the given manuscript

dataProperty.name: dateOfCollection
dataProperty.label: Date of collection
dataProperty.desc: Date when the textual materials are recorded

dataProperty.name: ageOfInformant
dataProperty.label: Age of informant
dataProperty.desc: Age of informer at the time the information is recorded

dataProperty.name: hasMusicSpace
dataProperty.label: Does it have space meant for music notation?
dataProperty.desc: Whether there was blank space for music notation

dataProperty.name: integrity
dataProperty.label: Integrity
dataProperty.desc: Preservation status of text

dataProperty.name: isDuplicate
dataProperty.label: Has this poem been copied twice in the same source?
dataProperty.desc: Whether there is another witness for the same Opus in the same PrimarySource

dataProperty.name: hasMusicalNotation
dataProperty.label: Does it have musical notation?
dataProperty.desc: Whether the witness contains musical notation

dataProperty.name: isPrint
dataProperty.label: Is it print?
dataProperty.desc: Whether the item is printed

dataProperty.name: isAutograph
dataProperty.label: is it an autograph?
dataProperty.desc: Whether the witness is an autograph, that is, if it is transcribed entirely in the handwriting of its author

dataProperty.name: isRefrainOmitted
dataProperty.label: Has the refrain been omitted?
dataProperty.desc: Whether the copy of the refrain was omitted

dataProperty.name: layoutNote
dataProperty.label: Layout note
dataProperty.desc: Commentary on the layout

dataProperty.name: lengthUnit
dataProperty.label: Length unit
dataProperty.desc: Names the unit used for the measurement

dataProperty.name: lengthQuantity
dataProperty.label: Length quantity
dataProperty.desc: Specifies the length in the unit selected in the property lengthUnit

dataProperty.name: location
dataProperty.label: Location
dataProperty.desc: The particular position of a piece of information in a text

dataProperty.name: volumeNumber
dataProperty.label: Volume number
dataProperty.desc: Number of the volume

dataProperty.name: numberOfColumns
dataProperty.label: Number of columns
dataProperty.desc: Number of columns the copy occupies

dataProperty.name: numberOfPages
dataProperty.label: Number of pages
dataProperty.desc: Number of pages the copy occupies

dataProperty.name: numberOfRows
dataProperty.label: Number of rows
dataProperty.desc: Number of continuous lines of writing

dataProperty.name: numberOfStaves
dataProperty.label: Number of staves
dataProperty.desc: Number of staves

dataProperty.name: quireNumber
dataProperty.label: Quire number
dataProperty.desc: Number of quire

dataProperty.name: quireStructure
dataProperty.label: Quire structure
dataProperty.desc: Structure of the quires

class.name: Word
class.desc: A single distinct meaningful element of writing, used with others (or sometimes alone) to form a sentence and typically shown with a space on either side when written or printed The word “life”

objectProperty.name: isMentionedIn
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the instance of Apparatus in which the Word is referred

objectProperty.name: isMentionedIn
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the instance of Reading in which the Word is referred

objectProperty.name: isMentionedIn
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the instance of Line in which the Word is referred

objectProperty.name: isReferencedIn
objectProperty.label: Do you a reference for this word, most likely a dictionary reference?
objectProperty.desc: This property points to a particular section of a bibliographic item (an instance of Location) whose contents are related to the current item under analysis (usually, the specific location of a bibliographic reference)

objectProperty.name: hasFirstSyllable
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the first syllable of the word (an instance of Syllable)

objectProperty.name: isFirstToken
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the container (an instance of Line) of which the current item under analysis is its first token

objectProperty.name: nextToken
objectProperty.label: If you care about the order of the tokens in the line, do you want to define the next token (only if it is a word)
objectProperty.desc: This property points to an instance of Word that follows the current item under analysis

objectProperty.name: previousToken
objectProperty.desc: This property points to an instance of Word that preceeds the current item under analysis

objectProperty.name: previousToken
objectProperty.desc: This property points to an instance of Punctuation that preceeds the current item under analysis

objectProperty.name: nextToken
objectProperty.label: If you care about the order of the tokens in the line, do you want to define the next token (only if it is a punctuation sign)
objectProperty.desc: This property points to an instance of Punctuation that follows the current item under analysis

objectProperty.name: isRhymeWord
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the instance of Rhyme that contains the item at hand as its rhyme word

objectProperty.name: isRhymeWord
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the instance of RhymeMatch that contains the item at hand as its rhyme word

objectProperty.name: presents
objectProperty.label: Do you want to define the figures of speech of this word?
objectProperty.desc: This propery points to an instance of FigureOfSpeech that is contained in the current item under analysis

objectProperty.name: hasRelationWith
objectProperty.desc: This propery points to the instance of FigureOfSpeech which defines the relation between the Word under analysis an a another instance of Word

objectProperty.name: isInflectedForm
objectProperty.desc: This property points to its lemma (an instance of Word)

objectProperty.name: isLemma
objectProperty.desc: This property points to one of the inflected forms (an instance of Word) of the current headword (the Word at hand)

dataProperty.name: content
dataProperty.label: Content
dataProperty.desc: Full content of item

dataProperty.name: hasDiastole
dataProperty.label: Does it have a diastole?
dataProperty.desc: It contains the lengthening of a normally short syllable

dataProperty.name: hasElision
dataProperty.label: Does it have an elision?
dataProperty.desc: It presents the combination of two syllables into one for the purposes of poetic scansion

dataProperty.name: hasHiatus
dataProperty.label: Does it have a hiatus?
dataProperty.desc: It contains the separate pronunciation of the two vowels in a diphthong for the sake of meter

dataProperty.name: hiatusPart1
dataProperty.label: First vowel of an hiatus
dataProperty.desc: First vowel affected in a hiatus phenomenon

dataProperty.name: hiatusPart2
dataProperty.label: Second vowel of an hiatus
dataProperty.desc: Second vowel affected in a hiatus phenomenon

dataProperty.name: hasSynizesis
dataProperty.label: Does it have a synizesis?
dataProperty.desc: It presents the union in pronunciation of two adjacent vowels into one syllable without forming a diphthong

dataProperty.name: hasSystole
dataProperty.label: Does it have a systole?
dataProperty.desc: It contains the shortening of a syllable regularly long

dataProperty.name: lemma
dataProperty.label: Lemma
dataProperty.desc: Citation form, the particular form that is chosen by convention to represent the lexeme

dataProperty.name: morphologicalAnnotation
dataProperty.label: Morphological annotation
dataProperty.desc: Any type of morphological analysis (from POS to morpheme composition)

dataProperty.name: phoneticTranscription
dataProperty.label: Phonetic transcription
dataProperty.desc: Phonetic transcription

dataProperty.name: regularisedSpelling
dataProperty.label: Regularised spelling
dataProperty.desc: Contains a reading which has been regularized or normalized regarding its orthography

dataProperty.name: translation
dataProperty.label: Translation
dataProperty.desc: Translation of the word

dataProperty.name: sense
dataProperty.label: Sense
dataProperty.desc: One of the meanings of a word or phrase

class.name: WorkPattern
class.desc: The prosodic analysis using a Redaction as the unit of reference The complete distribution of accented syllables of a work

objectProperty.name: analyses
objectProperty.desc: This propery points to an instance of Redaction about which the item at hand presents analytical information

objectProperty.name: uses
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the instance of MetricalEncoding in which the conventions implemented in the item at hand are explained

objectProperty.name: isReferencedIn
objectProperty.label: Is this analysis (or part of this analysis) referenced in a specific bibliography (e.g repertoire, catalogue, etc.)
objectProperty.desc: This property points to a particular section of a bibliographic item (an instance of Location) whose contents are related to the current item under analysis (usually, the specific location of a bibliographic reference)

dataProperty.name: metricalCategory
dataProperty.label: Metrical category
dataProperty.desc: Major category to identify the metrical type (e.g. fixed forms vs strophic)

dataProperty.name: metricalType
dataProperty.label: Metrical type
dataProperty.desc: Categorisation of the work according to metrics

dataProperty.name: metricalTypeDescription
dataProperty.label: Metrical type description
dataProperty.desc: Commentary on the categorisation attending to metrics

dataProperty.name: isSpecific
dataProperty.label: Do you use a particular categorisation?
dataProperty.desc: The categorisation given is not a standardized one but the result of the analysis

dataProperty.name: accentualMetricalScheme
dataProperty.label: Accentual metrical scheme
dataProperty.desc: Metrical scheme for accentual or accentual-syllabic metre

dataProperty.name: rhythmicalNotation
dataProperty.label: Rhythmical notation
dataProperty.desc: Notation based on the distribution of weak and strong positions for rhythmical purposes. Specially meant for non-accentual/quantitative versification

dataProperty.name: syllabicMetricalScheme
dataProperty.label: Syllabic metrical scheme
dataProperty.desc: Metrical scheme according to the number of syllables

dataProperty.name: altSyllabicMetricalScheme
dataProperty.label: Alternative syllabic metrical scheme
dataProperty.desc: Alternative metrical schema (e.g. long lines with caesura opposite to short lines)

dataProperty.name: versificationType
dataProperty.label: Type of versification
dataProperty.desc: Type of metre. The four major types are: accentual verse, accentual-syllabic verse, syllabic verse and quantitative verse.

dataProperty.name: grammaticalStressPattern
dataProperty.label: Grammatical stress pattern
dataProperty.desc: Pattern based on disposition of the expected stresses according to grammar rules. This includes the distribution of weak and strong positions

dataProperty.name: rhymeScheme
dataProperty.label: Rhyme scheme
dataProperty.desc: A rhyme scheme is the pattern of rhymes at the end of each line of a poem or song. It is usually referred to by using letters to indicate which lines rhyme; lines designated with the same letter all rhyme with each other

dataProperty.name: altRhymeScheme
dataProperty.label: Alternative rhyme scheme
dataProperty.desc: An alternative rhyme scheme (usually in relation with an alternative metrical scheme)

dataProperty.name: metricalComplexity
dataProperty.label: Metrical complexity
dataProperty.desc: Categorisation depending on the number of syllables: usually, less or more than eight

dataProperty.name: metricalContext
dataProperty.label: Metrical context
dataProperty.desc: Categorisation depending on whether all lines have the same number of syllables

dataProperty.name: typeOfRhymeMatching
dataProperty.label: Type of rhyme matching (e.g. assonant or consonant)
dataProperty.desc: Categorisation of the work according to the degree in which the different rhyming sounds match (e.g. assonant, consonant...)

dataProperty.name: hasRefrain
dataProperty.label: Does it have a refrain?
dataProperty.desc: Whether the work has a refrain

dataProperty.name: clausulaSchemeType
dataProperty.label: Type of poem according to clausulae/rhyme gender
dataProperty.desc: Categorisation of thework according to the distribution of clausulae/gender of rhymes (eg. “classic”, “heterogonique”, etc.)

dataProperty.name: isIsometric
dataProperty.label: Is it isometric?
dataProperty.desc: Whether the work is monometric, that is, if all lines have the same metrical analysis

dataProperty.name: isIsostrophic
dataProperty.label: Is it isostrophic?
dataProperty.desc: Whether all stanzas are metrically equivalent

dataProperty.name: isUnissonant
dataProperty.label: Is it unissonant?
dataProperty.desc: Whether all stanzas have the same rhyme

dataProperty.name: rhymeTypeProportion
dataProperty.label: Rhyme type proportion
dataProperty.desc: Proportion of the feminine/masculine rhymes of the poem

dataProperty.name: interstrophicRelations
dataProperty.label: Interstrophic relations
dataProperty.desc: Type of technique used to related stanzas by the repetition of sounds

dataProperty.name: hasAnacrusis
dataProperty.label: Does it have an anacrusis?
dataProperty.desc: Line with one or more unstressed syllables at the beginning of a line of verse, before the reckoning of the normal meter begins

dataProperty.name: hasCaesura
dataProperty.label: Does it have any caesurae?
dataProperty.desc: Whether it contains any lines with a pause/break near its middle

dataProperty.name: numberOfStanzas
dataProperty.label: Number of stanzas
dataProperty.desc: Number of stanzas

dataProperty.name: numberOfLines
dataProperty.label: Number of lines
dataProperty.desc: Number of lines in item

dataProperty.name: numberOfSyllables
dataProperty.label: Number of syllables
dataProperty.desc: The exact number of syllables, that is, without paying attention to any metrical phenomena that may affect the counting

dataProperty.name: metricalNotes
dataProperty.label: Metrical notes
dataProperty.desc: Metrical commentary

dataProperty.name: notes
dataProperty.label: Notes
dataProperty.desc: Comment or explanations

class.name: Organisation
class.desc: Named collection of people regarded as a single unit Typical examples include institutions such as ‘UNED’ or ‘the BBC’ and businesses such as ‘Google’ but also racial or ethnic groupings or political factions where these are regarded as forming a single agency such as ‘the Carthaginians’ or ‘the Communists’

objectProperty.name: ordersCreation
objectProperty.desc: This property points to an artifact (instance of PrimarySource) which was created by the command of the Organisation at hand

objectProperty.name: wasOwner
objectProperty.desc: This property points to an artifact (instance of PrimarySource) which at some point was owned by the Organisation at hand

objectProperty.name: creates
objectProperty.desc: This property points to a bibliographic item (an instance of BibliographicSource) which was authored by the current Organisation

objectProperty.name: isEditor
objectProperty.desc: This property points to a bibliographic item (an instance of BibliographicSource) which was edited by the current Organisation

objectProperty.name: hasMember
objectProperty.label: Do you want to specify any known members of this organisation?
objectProperty.desc: This property points to one of the persons (instance of Person) who belongs to the current Organisation

objectProperty.name: isMentionedIn
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the Redaction in which the current instance of Organisation is referenced

objectProperty.name: isMentionedIn
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the Paratext in which the current instance of Organisation is referenced

objectProperty.name: isMentionedIn
objectProperty.desc: This property points to the Line in which the current instance of Organisation is referenced

dataProperty.name: name
dataProperty.label: Name
dataProperty.desc: Contains a proper noun or noun phrase that refers the current item

dataProperty.name: address
dataProperty.label: Address
dataProperty.desc: Contains a postal address, for example of a publisher, an organisation, or an individual

dataProperty.name: uri
dataProperty.label: URI
dataProperty.desc: URI to a Linked Open Data resource
